i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.fluoroantimonic: Now we have Fluoroantimonic Acid. This is the catalyst that we were processing towards for our Naq processing line.
Make sure that you passive this in a renewable manner, as we will need to keep the Naq processing line running.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.focusedEnergy.1: With the power requirements of the structure, something is needed to ensure the energy can be transmitted properly.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.focusedEnergy.2: These Energy Transmitters will do the trick.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.forgeHammerUsag: Forge Hammers can turn rods into long rods or ingots into plates, among other things
There are other, cheaper ways to make long rods and plates, but they come later
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.fusionCasings.1: Well technically its more. Weve already used these previously.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.fusionCasings.2: At least they arent that hard to craft.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.fusionReactor.1: Fusion Reactions are the opposite of typical Nuclear reactions. Rather than splitting an atom, which causes massive amounts of energy to be released, Fusion is the merging of 2 atoms nuclei, which also causes a massive release of energy, and results in the creation of new materials.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.fusionReactor.2: Thats what we will be using the Fusion Reactor for. We want the resultant materials for further processing and use in recipes!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.fusionReactorMk: The Fusion Reactor Mk. III. Im sure you have already seen what is to come. So you understand that parts of this is necessary.
While that is true of whats to come, that doesnt mean the Mk.III isnt of value to us in its intended use.
Make at least 1 Mk.III Reactor. It will serve you well.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.fusionReactorRe: The following are all resulting resources from processing in the Fusion Reactor.
We need to keep working down the processing line of these resources but they aren't all needed quite yet.
That being said, getting an early start on processing them will greatly benefit you later on.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.futuristicWafer: The next evolution of our CPU wafers. These futuristic Wafers usher in the Quantum Age!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.galliumSearch.1: We were messing with the Arsenic earlier, and it seemed odd that there was no Gallium in sight.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.galliumSearch.2: But dont fear, we found the Gallium!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.gelatin: Gelatin is a protein made from animal collagen, usually from cows and pigs.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.gemLens.1: Insert gem plate and get gem lens
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.gigawatts.2: Yes, we are not direclty utilizing this immediately. But setting it up now to craft and collect will be very beneficial, and save you a ton of time!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.glassLensDye.1: That liquid §bcyan dye§r plus the Glass Lens in this machine will dye it into a §bGlass Lens (Cyan)§r
A Glass Lens (Green) can also make this, but making the colored glass lens is an HV recipe
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.glassLensRed.1: A Glass Lens (Red) can also make this, but making glass lenses is an HV recipe
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.glassPlateOptio: There are a few ways to make this, pick the one that works best for you!
§eExtracting§r glass into a liquid and then §efluid solidifying§r that into a plate
§aMacerating§r glass into glass dust and then §aalloy smelting§r that into a plate
Using a §bcutter§r to turn glass directly into a glass plate
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.glassTubeCreati: Smash some glass with a hammer and alloy smelt the dust with a casting mold to make a glass tube
You can get steel ingots by smelting steel dust, made by mixing iron dust with coal
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.glycerol.1: Okay yes, you could've made Glycerol§r without the §aLCR§r, but then you wouldn't be able to make it in large batches!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.glycerol.2: One Sodium Hydroxide Dust with §654 Buckets of Fish Oil§r and §c9 Buckets of Ethanol§r is my go to for §d9 Buckets of Glycerol§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.glycerol.3: This also makes a load of Bio Diesel, which can be a fantastic fuel source, especially if you make it Cetane Boosted Diesel
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.goodStuff.2: Our Fusion Reactor is making the good stuff now!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.gravistarImport: The Gravistar is another very important component for our high tier machines were going to be making.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.gregStarBase.1: Before we can piece together the GregStar with all the components from this page, you need to craft the base the star will be build upon.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.gregStarBase.2: The Robust Star Housing is strong enough to withstand the forces exerted in the star forge, and support the components that make up the GregStar
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.gregStarIntrodu: At Long Last we have reached our Destination. You have crafted the Coveted §l§1GregStar!§r§r
The culmination of achievements through each tier of GregTech, mastering each processing line and obtaining materials, machines, and items with increased difficulty each Tier.
But you have done it. You made it. The GregStar!
There is still more to do, so get your head back in the game, and get ready for the BIGGEST challenge yet! Literally.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.gregStarShard: The GregStar can be broken into Shards. We can then utilize those shards to make one of the most OP items!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.grindDiorite.1: Grind that diorite into diorite dust! You'll also get a small chance at stone dust, which you will need to account for
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.grindDiorite.2: It is recommended that you auto output into a buffer chest/barrel and just trash the stone dust
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.growthMedium: A growth medium or culture medium is a solid, liquid, or semi-solid designed to support the growth of a population of microorganisms or cells via the process of cell proliferation or small plants like the moss Physcomitrella patens.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.handyTools.1: §aScrewdrivers§r are a crafting tool and are used in special configuration of machines and Covers
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.handyTools.2: §aWire cutters§r are a crafting tool and right clicking on wires/cables will enable or disable connections to other blocks
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.handyTools.3: §aMortars§r are a crafting tool to grind things to dust
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.handyTools.5: §eSoft Mallets§r will pause and resume machines from working with right click
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.handyTools.6: §eCrowbars§r can be used to remove Covers from GT machines with a right click
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.handyTools.7: §eScythes§r can automatically break and re-plant crops in an area and doubles as a cool looking weapon!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.handyTools.8: §ePlungers§r can clear stuck fluids from GT machines §c§l[NYI]§r§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.handyTools.9: §eButchery Knives§r have Looting III implicitly, useful for leather early on!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hastelloyC276Pr: HASTELLOY C276 is a Nickel-chromium-molybdenum wrought alloy that is considered the most versatile corrosion resistant alloy available.
This alloy is resistant to the formation of grain boundary precipitates in the weld heat-affected zone, thus making it suitable for most chemical process applications in an as welded condition.
Alloy C-276 also has excellent resistance to pitting, stress-corrosion cracking and oxidizing atmospheres up to 1900°F, and has exceptional resistance to a wide variety of chemical environments.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hastelloyXPrope: Hastelloy X is a wrought nickel base alloy with excellent high temperature strength and oxidation resistance. All of the product forms are excellent in terms of forming and welding.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.heavyOil: Burning 16 logs on §bProgram 3§r will produce Heavy Oil
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.heliumPlasma: Of all the elements, Helium is the most stable; it will not burn or react with other elements. Helium has the lowst melting point and boiling points. It exists as a gas, except under extreme conditions where it can be transitioned into the 4th State of Matter, Plasma.
I honestly don't know what the E, G, or S letters mean... but this is still High Speed Steel!
You'll have to smelt this and then turn it into §bRings§r for the §dAdvanced SMD Inductor§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.highTierPlates: Now these are some high tier plates! But its reasonable for the Highest tier Machine Hull to require the highest tier plates.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.highVoltage.2: With the Advanced Integrated Circuit you have successfully made it to High Voltage!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.highVoltage.3: You can toss out those old recipes for Basic Electronic Circuits and Good Electronic Circuits and replace them with their Integrated versions
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.highVoltageShee: You'll need thin sheets and foil to make this, both of which can be made in a §eBender§r
You could §eFluid Solidify§r your polyethylene into sheets directly, or perhaps you solidify it into ingots to make blocks to then §eCutter§r into 9 sheets at once
By now you've seen that there are many roads we can take to achieve the same end result, so feel free to experiment and make things in different ways!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.horsepower.1: Now were talking! Our machines have some Horsepower behind them. However, even if it seems ridiculous, we are going to need more!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.horsepower.2: But this will do for now.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hotIngotNichrom: A very hot ingot indeed! This one requires the §bNichrome Coil Blocks§r on your §aEBF§r to process!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hotSilicon.1: Put those dusts we just made into your electric blast furnace and get some hot silicon!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hotSilicon.2: Holding a hot ingot will damage you, but you have to for this quest because I'm a little evil
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hotSilicon.3: You will need to cool it, in this case with a chemical bath
High-strength low-alloy steel (HSLA) is a type of alloy steel that provides better mechanical properties or greater resistance to corrosion than carbon steel.
HSLA steels vary from other steels in that they are not made to meet a specific chemical composition but rather specific mechanical properties.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hvChemicalReact: You'll need an §6HV Chemical Reactor§r with some Chlorine, Carbon dust, and your Rutile dust to make this
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hvCircuits.1: The final form of the HV circuits, but not the most cost efficient - yet
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hvCircuits.2: For now you'll be using these to make the higher tier circuits, up to LuV!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hvSuperconducto: 16x Mercury Barium Calcium Cuprate wire - Qty 8
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hydrofluoricAci: You know the drill, we'll §eChemical React§r the §3Hydrofluoric Acid§r with the §5Chloroform§r and make §dTetrafluoroethylene§r
§eChemical React§r Hydrogen with Fluorine Gas to make this
Later on you can also set up reprocessing of §5Titanium Trifluoride§r with Hydrogen in an §aEBF§r to get some Hydrofluoric Acid back
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hydrogenChlorin: A little hydrogen and chlorine together in a §echemical reactor§r will result in some HCl
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.hydrogenSources: Hydrogen, like chlorine, can come from many sources
For example, you could try §ecentrifuging§r goethite or yellow limonite dust, or perhaps §eelectrolyzing§r is more your speed.
Both water and salt water are good sources of hydrogen, and salt water comes with the added benefit of giving you chlorine too!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.incoloyAdvantag: Incoloy products are mostly chromium-based and mostly nickel-based, and designed for corrosion resistance as well as strength at high temperatures.
Incoloy alloys belong to the category of super austenitic stainless steels. One advantage is that Incoloy alloys do not have to be heat treated after welding to restore the corrosion resistance.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.inertMetal.1: Now that we have broken down the Inert Metal mixure, we have 2 new resources, both of which are extremely valuable to us in the §dLuv§r Tier! Make sure to get a passive line going so we have a constant supply of these resources flowing in!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.infectiousBucke: You really ought to be careful with this bucket.
Im sure you dont want to get an infection from it.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.iridiumChloride: This step is easy, we just §eCentrifuge§r our Residue and we're left with Iridium Chloride and some sludge
You can further process that sludge if you want to, but it isn't necessary to get the coveted Iridium
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.iridiumOre.1: Iridium Ore is truly quite rare, so I wouldn't be surprised if you have not found any
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.iridiumOre.2: As such, we can work on more of the §6PlatLine™§r to acquire Iridium
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.iv: Finally! We now have a crafting recipe that gives us 2 LuV processors for 1 Craft! Lets Gooo!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ivCircuit.1: This unlocks a single recipe for us, the §1IV§r Circuit!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ivCircuit.2: Don't rush ahead and just craft this and the circuit thinking that you can skip this age though
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ivCircuits: Easier IV circuits, but why stop here! Pushing onwards and you'll achieve the coveted Ludicrous Voltage circuits!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ivSuperconducto: Do you feel like you are levitating yet? Might be all that shulker from that Soul Vial.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ivTierAdvanceme: The §l§1IV Tier§r§r has brought us into a new age. Moving forward our processes increase in depth and mutliplicity, as such there exists a multiblock version of all the major machines youve used from Previous tiers.
§e§lNote:§r§r While not immediately necessary, it would behoove you to consider utilizing some of these Multiblocks moving forward, as it will enhance your current processing speeds.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.jumpStart.2: This is it! The Highest tier Processor you can make!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.jumpStart.3: But you're not done yet... This may be the last processor, but theres still more to come. Its going to get even more fun from this point on!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.laminatedGlassA: Finally, you have achieved the next tier of glass, §dLaminated Glass§r!
This stuff is used to make many IV and LuV machines
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.laminatedGlassM: Speaking of machines needing Laminated Glass... This is the first one we'll make!
You need a higher tier cutter to cut the higher tier chips to achieve higher tiers of power
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.largeArcFurnace: The Large Arc Furnace multiblock structure. This structure is the Large version of the Arc Furnace that we have been using for items such as Annealed Copper and Tempered Glass, as well as recovery of resources from machines we dont need anymore.
We can add a parallelizing block now, and run many recipies in parallel, speeding up the process times!
These Casings will be used to form the Large Arc Furnace multiblock structure.
Luckily these casings are made of material that does not require the Alloy Blast Smelter to create them. Smooth Sailing!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.largeAutoclave: Ever feel like the Autoclave just wasnt enough for you? Well than this multiblock will fill that void! This large structure is a direct replacement for the single block Autoclave!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.largeBrewingVat: These blocks are Corrosion proof, and its a good thing, as they will be used to make the Large Brewing Vat.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.largeChemReacto: Only the §eLarge Chemical Reactor§r can handle this reaction!
We won't use the Acidic Osmium Solution because Osmium is plentiful
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.largeChemicalBa: The §6Large Chemical Bath§r can make large batch processing of resources a breeze! Im certain you will have a few of these setup in your base for the resources to come.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.largeChemicalRe: Now you need that §aLarge Chemical Reactor§r to make this
Note that the Zinc Dust is §c§lNot Consumed§r, meaning you should not include it in the recipe for autocrafting this - instead put one in your Input Bus and leave it there

§3Ammonia§r can come from §eChemical Reacting§r §9Hydrogen§r with §bNitrogen Gas§r which you can get from a §eGas Collector§r in the §2Overworld§r, feeding a §aVacuum Freezer§r, feeding a §aDistillation Tower§r
If you've already made the §aLarge Chemical Reactor§r you can make this stuff in bulk!
Otherwise, you're stuck using the §eChemical Reactor§r with a §6Tiny Pile of Copper Dust§r, §9Hydrogen§r, and §2Nitrochlorobenzene§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.largeExtraction: The Large Extraction Module functions just like the Extractor single block that we have used time and time again. Now you can run a lot through this Large Multiblock, and even parallelize the machine. (Parallelization of machines is the theme after all)
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.largeFractionin: The Large Fractioning Distillery is just like the Distillation Tower, but on steroids. Instead of having to add multiple LFD's to process a fluid out, you can utilize the Parallelization hatches.
This effectively makes the Large Fractioning Distillery Multiple multiblock structures, though thats the same case with any Multiblock with a Parallelizing hatch.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.largeSolidifyin: The Large Solidifying Array is a direct replacement for the smaller single block Fluid Solidifiers you have become familiar with.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.laserEngraver.1: Add another Laser Engraver to the stack, this time for the NAND chip! Useful for data storage and the Crystal Processor Supercomputer - more on that later though!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.laserEngraverLe: Yep, another lens added to the collection for the §eLaser Engraver§r... If you haven't yet, maybe make a few of those
As a reminder, the §eengraver§r makes the wafer, the §ecutter§r makes the chip
Another day, another lens for the §eLaser Engraver§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.laserEngraverRe: That's right, another §eLaser Engraver§r recipe... these quests are becoming non-linear
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.laserEngravers: Add another lens to the collection! Laser Engravers abound if you've been making one per lens
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.laserSourceHatc: And if 256 Amps seems like a lot, then think again. At least with Active Transformers.
This is the lowest tier Laser Source Hatch in Amperage. They run all the way up to 4096A Hatches. Now that's some Power!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lastAdvancedSMD: Finally, the last of the Advanced SMD Components
Be sure going forward that you make recipes using the Advanced SMD Components because they are cheaper
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lastCoil.1: This will be the last Coil we will have to craft for our Energy Hatches!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lastCoil.2: There is still 1 more tier after this, but in terms of the Coils used for Energy Hatches, this is the last tier that requires one as a crafting component!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lensMaking.1: Back to the §eLathe§r to turn that plate into a lens
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.liquidAmericium: Americium is typically used as a particle detector in Smoke Detectors.
The amount is incredibly tiny and harmless to people, but is very effective at detecting smoke, which is why it is used.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.liquidChromium: We have used a bunch of chromium already. But we again need to call on this highly resistive and high hardness metal, except in its liquid form.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.liquidLanthanum: Lanthanum is a soft and ductile, silvery-white metal that tarnishes slowly when exposed to air.
Here we will use its liquid form so the Fusion Reactor can form a byproduct for us.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.liquidLutetium: This is an odd element. It is extremely resistant to corrosion in dry climates, but it's not resistant in moist climates.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.liquidSilicon: This semi-conductor will be put to good use in order for our Fusion Reactor to produce a useful byproduct.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.liquidUranium: Liquid Uranium 235. Lets use this liquid to bind together the other components and craft the Absolute Reaction Plate
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.liquidizingMeta: Similar to the steam age, this will turn solid metals into their fluid form
Additionally, this will get you the raw rubber pulp
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.logicGates.1: Did you know that NOR logic gates can be used to make every other logic gate? That's why we use it so much for making circuits!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lotOfThis.1: I have a feeling we are going to need a LOT of this...
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lubricant.1: There are many ways to make lubricant
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lubricant.2: One way I would suggest is to extract fish oil from fish and then distill that into lubricant
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lubricant.3: Lubricant is very useful with a cutter because recipes using it are much faster compared to water for example
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ludicrousVoltag: Now that we have combined the previous materials, we have a Ludicrous Voltage Coil! Our multiblock structures will thank us with what we are going to make!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.luvAge: Finally, the §dLuV§r age has arrived - congratulations!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.luvEnergyUpgrad: We just made it so our Multiblock Structures can use §dLuV§r Tier energy. But how about going one step further, and giving them §4ZPM§r tier power?
This is what we are going to achieve. 4 Amps of §dLuV§r Energy Will give us §4ZPM§r tier energy!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.luvMachineProgr: Now you are One step closer to being able to make §dLuV§r tier machines!
Breaking into LuV! Lets continue progression and find out what §cZPM §7is all about!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.luvSuperconduct: 16x Indium Tin Barium Titanium Cuprate Wire - Qty 8
These LuV Tier Superconductor ingots will serve us well in making Superconductor Wires, and Fine Wire.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.luvTierPlates.1: These plates will be important in creating more §dLuV§r tier machines.
The Wire choices for LuV Tier aren't great, in terms of Amperage Loss.
For that Reason is recommended to use the SuperConductor cable, which doesn't need to be covered by rubber, and also has no Amperage Loss.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lvMachines.1: All LV Machines are gated behind this circuit
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lvMachines.2: It is recommended that you keep your steam machines around, as they'll still be useful in the next chapter
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lvMachines.3: Why does this quest require 32 circuits to complete? Well, this is due to a concept called Batch Crafting - rather than just craft one it is often better to craft many more than that to prepare for the upcoming crafts
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.lvMachines.4: If you've been automating as you go along, good! You can utilize something like a ME Requester/Requester for AE2/RS to keep a specified number of any item in your system - I'd recommend doing this with various crafting components (e.g. rubber and sticky resin) and adding to it as you progress through the chapters
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.macerationTower: Large Maceration Towers will be very important, as ore processing will continue to be very important as we get into new resources through the tiers.
As such having a Maceration tower that can parallelize the processes will optimize the Ore processing that still needs to happen.
While not necessary, the IV Macerator will give you a speed boost on processing Sheldonite, as this processing line can be quite §n§l§2TimeConsuming.§r§r§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.maceratorByprod: Finally, at §6HV§r you get access to the §dByproducts§r from the §eMacerator§r
These byproducts are often incredibly useful and will come in handy multiple times as you progress
The macerator is the first step in ore processing, but we'll come back to that later
For now, we need wood dust, so throw some wood in here and grind them up
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.machineCableRat: Machines and cables/wires are rated for operating at §lspecific Voltage tiers§l
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.machineHulls: Once you've got polyethylene set up, you can switch to making machine hulls in the Assembler to save on some materials
Upgrading your machines will grant you access to new recipes and increase their processing speed
This is called overclocking and can be configured in the GUI of the machine if you do not want to overclock (to conserve power for example)
Overclocking a recipe results in it processing twice as fast but using four times as much power - overall this means twice as much energy is used
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.machineUpgradeE: Upgrading this machine to §5EV§r unlocks recipes necessary for eventually making §bTungsten§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.machineVoltageD: Giving a machine too much voltage makes it §c§lexplode!§r§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.magnesiumProces: A little §dMagnesium dust§r with your Titanium Tetrachloride inside the §aElectric Blast Furnace§r will give you a very §lHOT§r ingot
Magnesium you can get from §6Ore Processing§r many things, but my personal favorite is §eElectrolyzing§r Obsidian dust
You can reclaim that magnesium and chlorine back by §eElectrolyzing§r the Magnesium Chloride you get
You'll need to cool the ingot off in the §aVacuum Freezer§r before you can use it for anything
§l§eNote:§r§r A little reminder to double check the temperature requirement for ingot recipes; this one requires something better than Cupronickel Coils, like §bKanthal Coils§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.magneticIronRod: Also makes those magnetic iron rods for just some energy - save your redstone!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.magneticRods.1: Of course we need a large format way to make all those magnetic rods that we use for all of our recipies!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.magneticRods.2: Let this machine handle all of that!
Grab your tools and open up the maintenance hatch, there are problems to fix!
With the appropriate tools you can click on the maintenance hatch to rectify any and all issues
Which tools you ask? When you open the GUI of the Maintenance Hatch you should see a little wrench icon floating off on the right, mouse over it and it will tell you
Once that is done, your new EBF is all ready to use!
Be aware, problems can arise again, but it is not often and is easy to fix
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.makeHSSVariants: Once you have the §eMixer§r, it is time to make some §dHigh Speed Steel§r (HSS) variants!
Maraging steels are steels that are known for possessing superior strength and toughness without losing ductility. Aging refers to the extended heat-treatment process.
These steels are a special class of very-low-carbon ultra-high-strength steels that derive their strength not from carbon, but from precipitation of intermetallic compounds.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.massiveEBF.1: Im sure you have made a whole lot of EBF's during your journey to get here.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.massiveEBF.2: There is a whole lot more to go. But now,  you can make yourself a Rotary Hearth Furnace, and get some Parallel tasks running! Lets speed that processing up!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.massiveMultiblo: Saying that this is a massive multiblock structure is an understatement.
It requires 3213 Atomic Casings, too many to fit in your inventory, so that part was left at 1 in the quest.
But the benefits are astounding. So give it a shot. It dual functions as a resource generator, and a power generator. The power gen numbers are insane.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.materialMix.2: Now we have a material that will make for an incredibly strong and heat resistant EBF Coil!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.materialMix.3: But thatll come a bit later. Were not there yet.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.meFluidInput.1: ME Fluid Input! Inputs fluids for your processes in Multiblocks, and even keeps a stock in the Hatch itself!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.meFluidOutput.1: ME Fluid Output! Takes the resulting fluids, or outputting byproduct fluids directly back to the ME system! Streamlined for sure!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.meIntegration.1: Attaching all of your Multiblocks to your ME system uses up a lot of Interfaces. Add in the fact that you need covers to manipulate the resources and it can get tiresome.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.meIntegration.2: Well fear not. These Hatches and Buses will help you streamline all of your multiblocks in a way you never would have thought possible! Imagine having ME capabilities integrated!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.meIntegration.3: Thats what we have here! And they are amazing tools for your multiblocks to utilize! They even have Programmable chips, so you can designate an ME Hatch/Bus for a specific process line!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.meItemInput.1: ME Item Input, just like an interface. There are 2 rows for you to utilize and link items to your multiblock.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.meItemOutput.1: ME Item Output! Have the resultant item go directly back into your ME system.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.meetCircuitAsse: We meet again. The Circuit Assembler.
Yes, this can be made before this chapter is complete. But everything in this chapter is necessary to ensure a smooth ZPM Tier run.
Its highly suggested you complete this tier, and get the resources and components listed, as it will make your journey in the next tier, that much smoother.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.megaFusionReact: Yes. We have Fusion Reactors Mk.I Mk.II and Mk.III. Now there is the Mega Fusion Reactor.
All play their own parts, and all are vital to us moving forwards. So again, get at it, and Make yourself the Mega Fusion Reactor.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.microUniverseDr: Preparing components for the Micro Universe Drill Ship.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mixHSLA.1: We need to mix up some HSLA to make Plates for the Alloy Blast Smelter's walls.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mixIndiumGalliu: This stuff will replace the Gallium Arsenide for the §3Advanced SMD Diode§r as well as be used extensively upgrading §cMPIC wafers§r to the higher voltage tiers
Moving forward a lot of mixed metals and alloys will need to be made in the ABS. As Fluids they are then pushed through a Vacuum Freezer with an Ingot Mold to make the ingots. The Multiblock Structures referenced in the following quests all have support blocks which utilize metals which need the ABS to be made. Making at least 1 Alloy Blast Smelter now will be beneficial.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mixerNeeded: The ZPM Mixer is needed to craft the Uranium Rhodium Dinaquadide that we need for our Fusion Reactor Mk.II.
Put Aluminium dust, Iron dust, and Chromium dust together in a §eMixer§r and watch it blend!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mixerUpgrade.1: You need this tier of Mixer to make §3Tungstensteel Dust§r as well as §dVanadium Gallium Dust§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mixerUsage.1: The mixer takes multiple materials and mixes them into a new material, very useful for higher quality steels and metal mixtures
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mixingRuthenium: Take that Ruthenium Dust and get to mixing!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mixingVesselImp: The Mixing Vessel is incredibly important especially for all of the alloys that are currently made, but for all of the alloys that are to come!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.molybdenumDisil: Were going to need some Molybdenum Disilicide to make the casings for the ABS.
This dust can easily be made in an EV Mixer and then EBF'd with EV and Kanthal Coils.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.monsterCoils.1: These monster Coils are the end of the line for coils.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.monsterCoils.2: With these Coils we can now processes the UHV Superconductors, and finally make them into ingots!
Lets add in some Industrial Foregoing Black Hole Controllers, just for good measure.
This way, we know that the resulting Star can be controlled, and its immense power wont run rampantly out of control.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.moreCoil.1: More fusion glass. Just this time we need it to craft a component, not for a multiblock.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.moreCoil.2: You may want to figure a way to passively produce these...
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.moreGears.2: Keep up the processing, were going to need quite a few of these Assembly lines as we move forward through the tiers!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.moreNaquadahNee: We're going to need more. A LOT more Naquadah.
At least we can get our Naquadah Coils going now, and help our EBF's to process more metals!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.moreWafers.1: More wafers per boule and higher tier chips are possible with this!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.moreWafers.2: Time to upgrade those old silicon boule wafer recipes? I think so!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.multiblockUpgra: Two of these can get your multiblocks up to IV!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.multiblockValue: This multiblock may not be used in as much QTY as the other multiblock structures, but it will prove its value, I promise!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.multiplyEndless: This will help us to multiply endlessly the Raw Crystal Chip's. Yes, there still a few other processing steps, but the return rate won't be as bad as the initial rate of 10%.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mutagen: In genetics, a mutagen is a physical or chemical agent that permanently changes genetic material, usually DNA, in an organism and thus increases the frequency of mutations above the natural background level
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mutatedCreature: Are we trying to create mutated sewer creatures?
I gotta go tell Master Splinter about this one...
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mvCutterCompone: A necessary component for the §bMV Cutter§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.mvElectricMotor: You'll need these for MV Electric Motors, a component for many MV machines
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.nanoCpuWafer.1: We'll §eChemical React§r the §0Raw Carbon Fibers§r with §6Liquid Glowstone§r and a §bCPU Wafer§r to make the §3Nano CPU Wafer§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.nanoCpuWafer.2: Glowstone dust through an §eExtractor§r makes liquid glowstone
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naqAlloy.1: Naquadah Alloy is very important for us to be able to make components for multiblocks and other machines.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naqAlloy.2: We will need a lot of Naq Alloy, so we can make all of the Naq Alloy Frames needed for the Rotary Hearth.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naqFrames.1: These Naquadah Frames will have a lot of uses as a component and building block.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naqFrames.2: Maybe passive these, as we are going to need a lot of them.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naquadahAlloySt: Now just 1 more processing step before you can finally craft the Naquadah Alloy Frame§l
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naquadahImporta: Naquadah is going to be an extremely vital component of this Tier as well as future tiers.
Naquadah or Naq in short is used in its many various forms from ZPM and onwards. If you know the origins of Naquadah, then all of these references make sense.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naquadahPipe.1: The Large Naquadah pipe is just one of many components out of the many various types of Naquadah.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naquadahPipe.2: But for now, we are planning ahead for the UV Electric Pump.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naquadahSolutio: Using a Large Chemical Reactor to mix the Naquadah Dust and the Fluoroantimonic Acid will net you 3 resources. We are after the Impure Enriched Naquadah Solution.
You can take the Titanium Trifluoride and EBF it to recoup some Hydrochloric Acid as well as a Titanium Ingot.
Save the Impure Naquadah Solution, as we will further process that down for Naquadria solution/Naquadria Ingots later on.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naquadahTypes.1: We are going to need many different types of Naquadah, this being one of them.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.naquadahTypes.2: Make sure you have a good system in place that can harvest a lot of Naquadah.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.nearCompletionC: Were almost there, to a completed Circuit Board strong enough for our Quantum Processors!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.necessaryCompon: A necessary Component in order for us to be able to craft our next tier of Energy Hatches!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.necessarySuperc: While this does take up quite a bit of the UHV Superconductors we just made, its absolutely necessary.
Trust me, you will be glad to have crafted these once you see what they are going to be used for.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.needRuridit.1: Youll need quite a bit of Ruridit. Passive your lines to keep a steady supply.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.neutonium: This is quite the lot of Neutonium. But, look around. There may be other ways to synthesize the resource.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.neutronReflecto: Neutron reflector is vital to the operations of any reactor. In this case we will be utilizing Iridium as the material for our Neutron Reflector.
These reflectors keep neutrons within the field of reaction, causing the chain to continue.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.neutroniumStart: While we don't have a direct need for Neutronium yet, it would be beneficial to start processing out some Neutronium.
You can use the neutronium, americium and other resources to make some superconductors, but again, it's not necessary... Yet...
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.neutroniumWafer: Neutronium Doped wafers. The highest grade and quality silicon!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.newMachines.1: Now that we can make ZPM Tier Hulls, we can prepare to get some crazy powerful machines.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.newMachines.2: We arent at the top tier yet, but still, you will notice that these machines are running processes from previous tiers at incredible rates!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.newOreProcessin: A new setup for ore processing!
You don't have to build a new setup just for this if you are clever with filters and your item flow, but a new setup is probably less work
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.newResources.1: This wont be inert for long! Once processed you will have a BUNCH of new resources in hand, which can be further processed into very useful materials!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.newResources.2: Make sure to get a passive processing line of this going, as you will need quite a bit of the resulting resources.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.newTier.1: Now we can bring a new Tier of power to our Multiblocks!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.nextVoltageCoil: Finally we have the means to make our next Voltage coil for Energy hatches as well as ZPM Motors for other ZPM tier Covers!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.nichromeMixer: 4 Nickel dust and 1 Chromium dust in a §eMixer§r is all you'll need for some Nichrome!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.nickelZincFerri: You might be wondering why I forced Nickel Zinc Ferrite ingots on you, and this recipe is exactly why!
You get the most bang for your buck when using Nickel Zinc Ferrite and Annealed Copper, both of which you can make!

You've got some options when it comes to making the NZF rings and the fine wire, an §eExtruder§r will get you the most rings for one ingot and a §eWiremill§r will turn ingots into wire and wire into fine wire
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.nitrationMixtur: Mixing §6Nitric Acid§r with §cSulfuric Acid§r makes a §eNitration Mixture§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.nitrochlorobenz: §eChemical React§r Chlorobenzene with the Nitration Mixture to make §2Nitrochlorobenzene§r
You'll also get §6Diluted Sulfuric Acid§r, which you can §eDistill§r back into full strength Sulfuric Acid
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.nitrogenPlasma: Did you know that plasma is considered the 4th state of Matter next to Solid, Liquid, and Gaseous?
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.nonABSMultibloc: A few of the Large Multiblock Structures do §nnot§r dont rely on the Alloy Blast Smelter to create resources for their blocks. The blocks for the Large Multiblock structures above are a couple of those machines that do not rely on the Alloy Blast Smelter.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.notAssemblyLine: Do not confuse this multiblock with the Assembly line! This multiblock IS an assembler and will do Assembler recipies, but it is NOT the assembler. The assembler does a different process and has different recipies than this machine.
That being said this multiblock is still amazing! Yet again, mutliple Programmed Circuits!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.notOil: This infact is not Crude Oil. Its literally Liquid Gold, Once of the densest elements on the periodic table!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oilDistillation: §6Sulfuric Gas§r from §aOil Distillation§r can be made into §7Refinery Gas§r
Refinery Gas can then be §aCracked§r into a different form depending on what you want to distill out of it
§3Light Hydro Cracked Gas§r is a great source of §dMethane§r and Hydrogen!
A alternative but slower route might be to §eCentrifuge§r mushrooms or §eDistill§r Fermented Biomass even
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.optimizeNaqLine: Optimize your Naq line, as your going to need quite a bit of Naquadah Plates for your ZPM Machine Hulls
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.optimizedCrafti: Having an optimized method to craft these, that takes minimal time will benefit you as you move forward.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oreFinder.1: Need help finding ores? Make yourself one of these and charge it up by placing it in any machine's energy slot
The all in one, big battery, big range ore/fluid finder
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oreFrequency.1: Every 3 chunks you'll find another ore vein!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oreProcessing.1: This is typically used in Ore Processing lines to get alternative byproducts by washing crushed ore in mercury or sodium persulfate
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oreProcessing.2: In this case though, it can also be used to cool hot silicon ingots
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oreProcessingNi: §aOre Processing§r Pyrochlore, Pyrolusite, and Tantalite all give Niobium as byproducts
You could also §eElectrolyze§r the Pyrochlore for guaranteed Niobium!
Be sure to stockpile this stuff, you'll use a lot of it in §dFoil§r and §2Fine Wire§r forms as you progress
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oreProcessingSe: Macerator -> Ore Washer -> Thermal Centrifuge -> Macerator
This is one setup for ore processing, you can check JEI for other possible setups!
Once you have this setup built at HV you will get many byproducts
Byproducts are often used for recipes further on, so be sure to revisit this at HV and keep them!
There are many ways to automate this setup, so it is left as an exercise for the reader
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oreSpacing.1: 3 chunks apart, in case you didn't know that already
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.osmiridiumIngot: Mixing Iridium and Osmium together will get you this Ingot! We have quite a few uses for this new resource. Having a bunch on standby may prove useful!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.osmiridiumProce: Lets take the Osmiridium  you made and process it into some Fine Wires. This plus the Magnetized Samarium Long Rods will net us some important progress!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.overclocking.1: Remember: Overclocking runs a recipe twice as fast but at four times power consumption
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.overclocking.2: As you start replacing machines, you can put the old ones in a macerator to reclaim some of the ingredients used in crafting it
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oxygenEarly.1: Passiving oxygen early on is highly recommended, as it is used a lot
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oxygenEarly.2: There are many ways to get oxygen, when looking in JEI make sure the recipe states Usage: LV or Usage: ULV
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oxygenEarly.3: Goethite dust can be centrifuged for oxygen, or perhaps electrolyzing sapphire dust is more your speed
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oxygenEarly.4: Alternatively, you could build a Basic Gas Collector and use that to collect air, which you would then centrifuge into oxygen. Water can also be electrolyzed into oxygen, but be aware, these methods are quite slow
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.oxygenPlasma: We have seen many liquids that are the result of processing by the Fusion Reactor.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.palladiumOre.1: §dPalladium Ore§r is quite rare, some alternative methods to acquiring it might be to give §bCrushed Platinum§r or §6Crushed Sheldonite Ore§r a §eChemical Bath§r in §cMercury§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.palladiumOre.2: Mercury you can get easily by §eCentrifuging§r Redstone Dust
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.parallelControl: Well if 64 Parallel processes werent enough, how about 256? Because thats exactly what this block does. It allows you to run 256 Parallel tasks!
This is the highest tier Parallel Control Hatch there is!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.parallelHatches: Parallelizing Hatches are going to be incredibly Important, especially moving forward with Large multiblock Structures!
The First tier of this hatch will allow 4 processes to run at the same time. But as we move up through the tiers, you can eventually run 256 processes at the same time!!
This is far more than the Processing Array, and as such, gives more value to these multiblocks over single blocks machines!
§l§eNote:§r§r This hatch is not actually required to build any of those multiblock machines
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.phenol.1: You'll get half the §6Phenol§r back when you turn this into §3Polybenzimidazole§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.plantBallCreati: Eight plants in a Compressor will create a plant ball
You can also get these as a chance output from the centrifuge when making glue
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.plasma.1: In the next section we are going to need to make a bunch of Micro Universe Catalysts.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.plasma.2: This component uses Star Matter Plasma to make the Catalysts.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.plasma.3: Although you dont need to make it now, it certainly would be very helpful, since we are going to need a bunch of Star Matter Plasma to make the 16x Catalysts.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.plateMachineUsa: With this machine you can turn one ingot into one plate easy-peasy
Further processing of plates will turn them into foils
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.platinumLineInt: The §dPlatLine™§r is something we'll get into later on, for now be thankful that platinum is plentiful
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.platinumResourc: Platinum Group Sludge will process down into a bunch of great resources that will help you moving forward.
Processing Sheldonite and purifying it will allow you to get the highest return on Platinum Group Sludge. This Sludge contains resources you need to progress.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.polybenzimidazo: Polybenzimidazole is a type of plastic known for its heat resistance
You'll use it for many applications as you progress, especially at the ZPM and above tiers, but the primary use will be making advanced circuit components!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.polyethylene.1: Ethylene with even more oxygen will make you Polyethylene
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.polyethylene.2: Do note you need to use §eProgram 1§r for this recipe
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.polyethylene.3: You could use air instead of oxygen, but you'll get less Polyethylene out
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.polyethylene.4: This stuff is very versatile, we'll be using a lot of it, so be sure to make a bunch or better yet make it passively
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.polyvinylAcetat: You could mix regular old §3Air§r with §eVinyl Acetate§r and get a 1:1 ratio of §6Polyvinyl Acetate§r, but why do that when using §bOxygen§r will boost output to 3:2
Why stop at just using Oxygen though! Adding a smidgen of §dTitanium Tetrachloride§r boosts the ratio to 2:1!
Regardless of which approach you take, keep note of which §aProgrammed Circuit§r is required to run the recipe
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.polyvinylChlori: A little oxygen with your vinyl chloride will get you Polyvinyl Chloride
§e§lTip:§r§r This is worth setting up a §bRequester§r for!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.powerUp.2: Now we can run our Multiblocks at UV Tier power?!?! Our EBF's are going to be super happy!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.poweringMultibl: One block stop for powering your multiblocks at IV!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.precursor.1: At this point, you have learned so much through the Tiers, you should be rewarded with something to display your knowledge!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.precursor.2: In this case, this certificate shall suffice. You are officially, Not a Noob anymore!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.prescientCrysta: Use 3 other crystals to craft this crystal.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.processingArray: The §aProcessing Array§r can run 16 recipes §din parallel§r for any of the single block machines you can make!
Why run in §bParallel§r when you can §6Overclock§r you ask? Well, parallelization is superior here because it doesn't use more power unlike overclocking
Additionally, you can utilize the §cDistinct Bus Mode§r with the (up to 10) different Input Busses on different Programmed Circuits for easier pattern automation with Extruders, Laser Engravers, etc
§e§lNote:§r§r Many of the single block machines have multiblock variants that are better, but I'm not going to go into those (yet)
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.processingBoost: Another tier up, another boost to processing time. But again, theres no time to get comfortable. The new resources we will be processing will need further advancements to bring those processing times down. So keep at it!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.processorCrafti: Now, take the Yttrium Barium Cuprate bolts we made, and the Crystal SOC, combine them together, and you get the cheapest available IV tier Processors!!
Remember, the controllers for most of the "Large" multiblocks of our machines use IV Processors in crafting them.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.progress.1: Still at 2 for 1 with ZPM, but we are making progress.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.progress.2: Soon enough we will be in the next tier and will get a far better return on our craft!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.propeneProducti: §9Carbon Monoxide§r can come from §aDistillation§r of §cLiquid Nether Air§r if you'd like a practically infinite source of the stuff
Tired of hunting around for ores and hoping you'll strike it rich? Are you looking for the oil that lies beneath? You need the §6HV§r §bProspector§r!
This tool will scan the area around you in a 4 chunk radius and tell you where to find the ore you are looking for
Additionally, you can sneak + right-click to change to Fluid Detection mode and find oil pools that lie beneath bedrock, all you'll need is a §eFluid Drilling Rig§r to access all that oil!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.purifiedSphaler: §bPurified Sphalerite§r and §5Purified Galena§r §eMixed§r with §6Sulfuric Acid§r will get you the start of one of the most coveted resources, §dIndium Concentrate§r
This stuff is important enough to warrant a separate §aOre Processing§r setup
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.pvcSheet.1: Use your polyvinyl chloride in a §efluid solidifier§r to get a sheet of it
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.pvcSheet.2: Throw that plus some copper foil and sulfuric acid together in your §echemical reactor§r and you'll get 2 plastic circuit boards!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.pvcSheet.3: Keep your eyes peeled, we'll eventually upgrade this recipe to get the coveted 8 plastic circuit boards at once
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.quadBatteries.1: 4 Large Naquadria Batteries will wrap up the required items for this component of the GregStar
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.quantumAge.1: Now that we are in the Quantum Age, Our machines are flying!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.quantumAge.2: But With greater processing, comes more complications. Power, resources, and processing lines. That doesnt deter us though, right? Thats exactly why we are here!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.quantumCpus: Quantum CPU's processing all the Qubits!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.quantumEyes.1: A quick chemical bath of your Ender Eyes in Radon will net you these §dQuantum Eyes§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.quantumEyes.2: Don't worry about making a bunch of these unless you want to upgrade all your §eLaser Engravers§r to EV (IV is the better upgrade though)
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.questCompletion: §c§lStop! Do not pass Go! Do not collect $200!§r§r
Did you complete all the other quests in this chapter already?
Good work, off you go then!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.quickWork.1: The cutter will make quick work of the boule and turn it into 16 wafers
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.quickWork.2: You can also use these wafers to make cheaper diodes - time to upgrade that recipe!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.radonGasAcquisi: There are two main ways to acquire §dRadon Gas§r

The best (because of the other outputs) is to use an §6HV§r §eGas Collector§r in §bThe End§r dimension, §aVacuum Freezer§r the collected §eEnder Air§r into §9Liquid Ender Air§r at §1IV§r, and then run that through a §aDistillation Tower§r at IV and receive Radon Gas
The alternative is to create the §aLarge Chemical Reactor§r and just react §3Air§r with some Uranium Dust and Plutonium Ingots - you even get the plutonium back!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.radonMistake: Raiden is a Fictional Character in the Mortal Kombat Fightin.... Oh wait... It said Radon, not Raiden...
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.radonNeed.1: We're going to need quite a bit of Radon moving forwards.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.radonNeed.2: If you haven't already, get a Distillation tower running to process some Liquid Ender Air for its Radon.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rareEarthCompon: We wont need a ton of these, but it will be a vital component of other parts, and vital to constructing some multiblock structures.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rareEarthNeodym: You should have a lot of Rare Earth from your processing line for your Neodymium. This will ensure that we can obtain Samarium.
If you have not passived your Neodymium production, you really ought to get on that. Once you see the amount of Samarium we get per Rare Earth will reinforce that statement.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rareResources.1: Now that we have the Fusion Reactor Mk1 running, we can obtain Rare Resources that are needed to advance us further into the next tiers!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rareResources.2: In this case, we have Europium. Which will be used frequently as we continue to climb up the tiers, and is even a component of the GregStar!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rawCarbonFibers: There are multiple ways to make Raw Carbon Fibers
One way is to use §69 mB Epoxy§r and 4 Carbon Dust in an §eAutoclave§r to get 4 out
Doing it this way is fine, but you also have the option of using §d9mB Polybenzimidazole§r and 8 Carbon Dust §2to get 16!§r
Your First Raw Crystal Chip may take quite a few tries to get.

But once you get it, you can reliably duplicate them using a simple loop of crafting a Raw Crystal Chip, Forge Hammering it, into Raw Crystal Chip parts, then processing those into more Raw Crystal Chips, and repeating.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rawGrowthMedium: We need some Growth Medium to help us in this processing line, but we dont have the final Growth Medium yet. This is just the Raw version.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.redAlloyCableCr: Red Alloy Cable is an integral part of crafting the §bLV Circuit§r and getting out of the Steam Age
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.reorganizingGTS: Weve all come to this issue before, and we all hate it. But its a necessary evil.

There comes a time with everyones GT setup (for me its many times), in which we have to tear down what we have built, to re-organize our machines to optimize processes, or create new processes we do not have set up yet. Dont fret doing this. I know it can seem like a pain, but you will be glad youve done so in the future. Especially when moving towards using Large Multiblocks over single machines for your processes.
The Main thing to remember, your Greg Tech Factory will look amazing as you reconfigure it with these multiblocks!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.repeatedQuestio: This question has been asked previously, but it will be asked again...
Can this thing brew some beers?
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.resistorCraftin: Don't worry, you don't need to craft resistors with different resistances
Still crafting resistors in a crafting grid?
Take that annealed copper, turn it into fine wire, then add a little glue and carbon to make 4 resistors at once in your Assembler
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.resourceGenerat: Why passively generate any resource? Because it is a good idea to generate common resources passively rather than order them on demand, that way you'll have what you need when you need it rather than having to wait a very long time for everything to run
Setup the Rock Crusher with water on the left and lava on the right in the world, then insert some cobblestone to make cobblestone
Output the cobblestone into a Forge Hammer to create gravel
Output the gravel into another Forge Hammer to create sand
Output the sand into an Arc Furnace with some oxygen to make glass
Output the glass into a Macerator to turn it into glass dust
Output the glass dust into a Centrifuge to get silicon dioxide
Output the silicon dioxide into an Electrolyzer and get silicon dust and oxygen!
All you need to get started is a little oxygen, given to you in the form of green sapphire dust!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rhodiumPalladiu: Now that we have Rhodium, we can mix it with Palladium to get Rhodium plated Palladium, and process those into ingots, then plates, and then we can make §dLuV§r tier Hulls, meaning §dLuV§r Tier machines!!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rockCrusher.1: Put water on the left and lava on the right of your §erock crusher§r, in the world, then insert a single diorite block in the rock crusher, and watch it create more diorite for you
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rodProduction.1: For all your rod production needs!
This bad boy unlocks a cheaper rubber crafting recipe!
For 1 sulfur dust and 9 raw rubber pulp you'll make the equivalent of 9 rubber ingots in fluid form
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rubberFarming.1: Find and farm rubber trees to get yourself some sticky resin
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rubberFarming.2: Alternatively, slime balls smelted in a furnace will get you some
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rubberSheetProd: Two rubber ingots and the casting mold in the alloy smelter will make sheets of rubber
These will come in handy when you need to start coating wires in rubber to make cables
All parts of the rubber tree can be extracted into raw rubber pulp
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rubyLens: One ruby plate in the Lathe will make a Ruby Lens
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rubyPlates.1: Insert a block of ruby into your cutter to get nine ruby plates
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ruridit.1: Now that we have pure Ruthenium, we can make it dirty again! Haha! Use a mixer to turn this into Ruridit. We will need quite a bit of Ruridit for other processes and items, including the Assembly Line!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rutileDust.1: I hope you've been keeping up with your ore gathering and processing!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rutileDust.2: You can get §dRutile Dust§r from several methods:
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rutileDust.5: §6Ore Process§r Ilmenite or Bauxite for a chanced output
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rutileDust.6: §eChemical Bath§r Aluminium in §3Sodium Persulfate§r for a higher chanced output
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.rutileDust.7: §cRemember:§r Chanced outputs increase with the tier of the machine
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.salsaIncident.1: So there I was, knee deep in salsa and covered in motor oil
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.salsaIncident.2: Anyway, I hope you are ready to do a lot of work with fluids!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.saltWaterElectr: Have you been §eElectrolyzing§r §9Salt Water§r? It is a great source of Chlorine Gas, which comes in handy especially with making Dichlorobenzene, and as a byproduct you'll get this §3Sodium Hydroxide Dust§r
You can then §eChemical React§r the Sodium Hydroxide Dust with your Dichlorobenzene to create §6Phenol§r!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.samSuperconduct: 16x Samarium Iron Arsenic Oxide wire - Qty 8
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.samariumProcess: Processe the Rare earth for Small Piles of Samarium, then compress the pieces together for a full Dust piece.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.samariumProgres: Samarium Long Rods, magnetized. Add in some fine wires,  and you got yourself some Progress!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.sapphireLens.1: Follow the same steps as the Emerald/Ruby lens to make the §9Sapphire Lens§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.screwsForPlates: Gotta have some screws to secure the Double Tungstensteel Plating. Im sure these will make things very secure.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.semiOrganics: Integrating Organics into our Non-Organic components, in the proper configuration with the proper organics will allow us to have infinite processing ability!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.shapingIngot: Once cooled we can begin to shape the ingot into more useful materials
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.siftingMultiblo: No one wants to get dirty by manually sifting everything. Let this multiblock do all your sifting needs, and get those gems that we need as we move towards the end!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.siliconDust.1: §e32x Silicon Dust§r and a §aSmall Pile of Gallium Arsenide Dust§r on §bProgram 2§r will make you one of these
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.siliconDust.2: It might be worth making a new EBF, one for just Program 1 recipes
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.singleEnergyHat: Why have 2 Energy Hatches when just one will do? This energy hatch accepts 4 Amps of IV all on its own!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.sodiumBisulfate: Salt and Sulfuric Acid on Program 1 will make Sodium Bisulfate
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.sodiumPersulfat: You have to start making Sodium Persulfate to put in a Chemical Bath, replacing the Ore Washer in a separate Ore Processing Setup for a chance at Gallium Dust when processing Bauxite
At HV+ you can Ore Process Bauxite or Sphalerite as another method of obtaining gallium
6 Tin dust, 3 Lead dust, and 1 Antimony dust all combine in a §eMixer§r on §aProgram 3§r to make 10 Soldering Alloy Dust
This will allow us to make circuits for less tin overall, as well as some items that require specifically soldering alloy!
You can use an §eExtractor§r on the dust to get it in liquid form
Solidify that Tritanium, and now we have a resource usable to us in many ways.
And believe me, many of our components we are going to be making will need Titanium.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.solidifiedEurop: Now that we have a solidified version of our Europium we can further process it into components for our Machines and Multiblocks!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.squeakyClean.1: Cover a steel frame with plastic sheets then smother it in concrete and let it set into §bPlascrete§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.squeakyClean.10: It's recommended you set a §bRequester§r up for this
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.squeakyClean.2: The edges and floor of the Cleanroom needs to be Plascrete
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.squeakyClean.3: Cleanroom Glass can be used for the walls in place of the Plascrete, just not the edges or floor
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.squeakyClean.4: Finally, with stainless steel we can begin crafting §6HV§r machines!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.squeakyClean.5: In your handy-dandy §eChemical Reactor§r insert the Plastic Circuit Board, some Copper Foil, and the Iron III Chloride you made to get the Plastic Printed Circuit Board
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.squeakyClean.6: This serves as the base for all the microprocessor circuits
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.squeakyClean.7: Hydrochloric acid and iron dust will §echemical react§r to give you Iron III Chloride
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.squeakyClean.8: Plus you get some hydrogen back!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.squeakyClean.9: Don't forget your §aprogram setting§r, it should be 1 for this
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.starCompression: Exchanging heat in any case is usually very expensive in Energy cost. In this case, some Tritainium coils, Ultimate Voltage Coils, and Large Naquadria Batteries will do the trick.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.starForge.1: So much of the work that has been done was directly to support being able to construct the §n§l§5Star Forge!§r§r§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.starMatter: Liquid Iron Plasma may seem like an odd resource, but its necessary for what you are going to make.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.starPlating: Add in UV power delivery blocks, and an ATM star, and BAM! You now have the Star Compression Module.
These are complex components to make. Making 1 of them is quite the task, involving many materials and many process lines.
Now we need 16 of them to proceed. But I'm sure you are up to the task.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.steamAgeIntro.1: Welcome to the Steam Age! Steam machines can process any recipe in JEI up to §e§lUsage: 32 EU/t (LV)§r§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.steamAgeIntro.2: There are High Pressure and Low Pressure variants of machines. Low Pressure machines will take twice as long to process a recipe but consume less steam.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.steamAgeIntro.3: §l§4NOTE:§r§r After every recipe, §n§6steam machines need to vent the used steam§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.steamAgeIntro.4: By default the vent is located on the back, but with your handy-dandy §bwrench§r you can change which side the exhaust port faces!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.steamAgeIntro.5: If the exhaust port is blocked, then the machine will fail to vent and stop working.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.steamConversion: Take that steam you were making and turn it into EU!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.steamTransfer.1: Now that you have steam, you need something to transfer it around!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.steamTransfer.2: Placing these will allow you to transfer steam from your boiler to a machine
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.steamTransfer.3: Use a §bwrench§r to add or remove connections as necessary
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.steamUsage.1: This uses even more steam! It might be time to build another boiler
Stellite alloys are a range of cobalt-chromium alloys designed for wear resistance.

Stellite alloys include a range of cobalt-based alloys, with significant proportions of chromium (up to 33%) and tungsten (up to 18%). Some of the alloys also contain nickel or molybdenum. Most of them are fairly high carbon content when compared to carbon steels.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.stemCells: Stem cells are the body's raw materials — cells from which all other cells with specialized functions are generated
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.stockingUp.1: While we cant use the HASOC directly to craft the LuV Tier Wetware processor, we can build up a backstock for when we have the proper machines to do so.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.stockingUp.2: And once we have the UV Circuit Assembler, we can make 4x LuV Tier Wetware processors with 1 craft!!!!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.stoneCreation.1: Setting this machine up with lava on one side and water on another allows you to create either stone or cobblestone
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.stoneCreation.2: At later tiers you can create any stone variant, even obsidian at HV!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.strongCircuitBo: Fiber Reinforced Circuit Boards, strong enough to support Quantum processors and the heat those qubits produce!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.strongLiquid.1: What a Strong liquid this is!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.strongLiquid.2: I wonder if liquid titanium would shine with irridescence like the metal does when its introduced to heat...
Now we can push 64Amps from our substations at the ZPM tier!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.substationPower: Bringing more power output to our Substations, which as we progress will help immensely in ensuring our equipment stays running!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.sulfurAcquisiti: You can find sulfur ore in the nether and then smelt it to get sulfur dust. There are also bees!
Put your raw rubber pulp and sulfur dust into an alloy smelter and get your first bit of rubber
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.sulfurDioxidePr: Chemical react sulfur dioxide with more oxygen to make sulfur trioxide
Oxygen is very important, you may want to go back and dedicate an entire setup to passively produce it if you haven't already
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.sulfuricAcidPro: Chemical react water with sulfur trioxide to get sulfuric acid
You can get infinite water in your digital storage system by connecting to a Kitchen Sink - just make sure it is set to extract only! Otherwise it will void fluids on insert
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.superConductorC: Now we can make a Super conductor, Naquadah Alloy, Trinium, and Europium ingots!
This is a powerful, highly accurate machine known for processing massive sets of data and complex calculations at rapid speeds.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.superconductorI: The last Superconductor we made was a while back. But now each tier's Superconductor will become more important, as well as allow us to have no Amperage loss cabling!
Now that we have the Superconductor in ingot form, we can finally process it out into the wire that we need!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.superconductors: Another Alloy for another tier of Superconductors!
Remember, Superconductors have 0A loss when transmitting EU across distances, making them the most highly sought after Wiring for your Factory
This superconducting coil has many uses with many different multiblocks, and within many different recipes! There are 3 different recipes for it as well.
In this use case, we are going to utilize the lowest tier, which has the highest resource cost, but is easiest format for us right now.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tantaliteProces: Also comes as a byproduct of tantalite ore processing!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tantalumCarbide: Tantalum Carbide Plates are required to make the Alloy Blast Smelter Controller.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.the: Liquid Oxygen Plasma. We have used a ton of Oxygen by now, but we still have more to use!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.theStarThatStar: The Base Star, the Patrick Star, that was used to make a Star, and now is the base for another Star that will be made into a Star.
Got it? K. Lets move on.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.thermalExchange: By this point, we are no stranger to Antimatter pellets.
We just need more of them for the GregStar. A LOT more of them.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.thiccGlass.1: Obviously with a process like Fusion Reaction, you need some good support materials. But what happens when you still want to see whats happening inside?
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.titaniumCarbide: Titanium Carbide dust for Titanium Carbide plates are the second item needed for the Alloy Blast Furnace walls.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.titaniumTungste: Titanium Tungsten Carbide is Ultra high purity mixed carbide additive for Cutting tool and wear part product. This alloy contains a high level of hardness and HT strength making it an incredibly strong and durable alloy.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tools.1: The §aWrench§r is a crafting tool, sure, but it is also a mining tool for GT machines! Right clicking sets the output side of GT machines and crouch right clicking rotates them
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tools.2: The §aFile§r is a crafting tool and that's all
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tools.3: The §aSaw§r is yet another crafting tool, but it can also get you 6 planks from one log!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.topTierExchange: Making Antimatter is always a challenge. Process lines, the time to process, and the power. This will check off one of those items that will no longer be a concern.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.transformers.1: You are going to need a Qty of 4 to proceed. In function these will transform power from UV to UHV power, but we dont need these for power conversion.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.transformers.2: Its going to be used as a crafting component.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.transistor.1: This Silicon Plate will allow us to make the Transistor! A new electrical component, yay!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.transistors.1: Transistors are truly a modern marvel and have allowed the electronic age to boom
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.transistors.2: They allow for much more complex electronics by amplifying signals and acting as a switch, introducing the capability for logic programming!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.transistors.3: In our case, they allow us to make the Integrated Circuit!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.triniumIngot: Take that Trinium Sulfide we got in the last quest, and put it in an EBF with Zinc, and out will pop a Hot Trinium Inogt. Cool that down and now we have the Trinium we are after.
Trinium Sulfide is a byproduct of our Naq line processing, but its a very necessary by product that will be used in great amounts.
As previously stated, you should really figure out how to passive the processing line. To be fair, at this point, everything should be passived.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.trioxideToTrifl: Getting closer to the catalyst that we need for the Naq line.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tungstateMining: You know what to do, §aOre Process§r some tungstate or some scheelite ore down into dust form
The raw ores are found in §eThe End Layer§r of §dThe Mining Dimension§r, between y levels -63 and 0, mixed in with Lithium. There may even be scheelite surface indicators!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tungstenAcquisi: Give that dust an acid bath with §bHydrochloric Acid§r in the §eChemical Bath§r to make this
You'll then need to §eElectrolyze§r it to get the §dTungsten§r out
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tungstenDustAcq: You need the §5EV Electrolyzer§r to get Tungsten Dust from the Tungstic Acid
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tungstenUsage: What good is regular Tungsten? Well, since you asked, it is an integral component of many IV Machines, primarily in the form of Tungsten Cables
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tungstensteel.1: Finally, Tungstensteel, now you can make IV Machines!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tungstensteel.2: This also allows for a coil upgrade for the EBF!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.tungstensteelDu: Primarily, we'll use this dust to make §dTungstensteel§r by §eMixing§r it with steel dust
Sometimes though, we'll need to throw this dust into the §eEBF§r on §aProgram 1§r to get the hot ingot, then cool it off in the §eVacuum Freezer§r to acquire the §3Tungsten Ingot§r
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.u235.1: If we needed something that could ensure the transmission of every tier, with the highest level of efficiency, what would we get?
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.u235.2: Maybe combining every Superconductor available into a single cable will do the trick!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.uhpic.1: These Wafers make the highest tier traditional Semi-Conductor chip, the UHPIC or Ultra High Power IC (Integrated Circuit).
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.uhpic.2: There will be a great demand on these chips from many of the machines we create from here on out.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.uhpicChips.1: The UHPIC chip once the wafer is broken down into chips by a Cutting machine.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.uhvEnergyHatch: This has the powerflow your Substations were looking for! Now you can give it All the Amps!
UHV Energy Hatch. We have finally reached the Pinnacle of Energy Hatches!
Now we can set our Multiblocks up to be able to processes any tier of power requirements!
While the UHV Energy Hatch is the Pinnacle of Energy Delivery, we still have the 4A UHV Energy Hatch.
And yes, this follows the same function as the previous Tiers, and will act like 2x Energy Hatches allowing you to power at a Higher Level.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.uhvHull.1: Great! Now we can craft the UHV Hull.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.uhvHull.2: But there doesnt seem to be UHV Machines. Why do we need this hull? Well for the Hatches and Buses of course!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.uhvSuperconduct: Just like all the other tiers, the UHV tier has its own Superconductor wire.
Thats exactly what we have here.
Take the UHV superconductor wire we just made and craft it into a 2x.
We need the 2x version for our next items we will be crafting up.
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ultimateBattery: Those other Battery companies have nothing on this!
This is the Ultimate Battery, and its UHV Tier! For all your power hungry devices (at UHV tier of course)
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ultimateVoltage: The Motor is a very important base component for the rest of the UV machine components and covers.
But in this case we need it to be able to make the Emitter and Sensor.
The UV Emitter is one part of 2 very important blocks. We will go over these blocks later.
The UV Sensor is the second part of 2 very important blocks. We will go over these blocks later.
The UV Robotic Arm has a very limit for how many items it can move when attached to a machine as a cover.
If you are using Robotic Arms as a cover on any of your machines, give this version a shot. You wont be disappointed!
The MkII Fusion Reactor speeds up the processing ability of the Fusion Reactor.

While the Fusion Reactor MkII lists 16 Energy Hatches as well as 16 output/input hatches, its not directly necessary. You can form the multiblock with less hatches. That being said, its cheaper to add in a bunch of hatches, rather than craft more Fusion Reactor Mk.II Casings.
The ZPM tier Circuit Assembler will allow us to craft the final collection of Processors, Minus the Mainframe.
64! You heard right, 64!
This hatch allows for you to run 64 parallel processes in your multiblock structures!
If you thought overclocks were amazing, just wait until you slap this bad larry into your multiblocks!
Weve used so much of the Fusion Reactor!
But I told you it was an important structure. If you havnt already, stacking rings of Fusion Reactors will help immensely.
Its a process to get Ruthenium already, but lets process it some more!
Trust me, itll be worth it!
Gallium ran away, so were left with just Arsenic, but thats okay, because we only need Arsenic!
Just preparing a backstock of HASOC's, so that once we unlock the proper machines, we can start crafting a bunch of processors!
Take that Neutronium Wafer, and put it in the Laser Engraver with a black lens, and we get the HASOC, which will help use immensely as we continue forwards.
Sorry for the Pun, but I couldnt resist.
Anyways, the silicon doped with Neutronium is highly efficient and fine grade, which gives us a massive return on 1 singular Boule!
We need the ZPM tier Laser Engraver so that we can make our Crystal SOC.
Trust me, this will be well worth it!
The Crystal CPU should already be well established in your processing lines. This is just 1 more step for those Crystal CPU's in order for them to achieve greatness!
Two Words. Ultimate Voltage.
But dont worry, we still have 1 more tier after this. But being able to make UV Tier machines will really help you fill out your Factory and speed up processlines.
The plates for the Hulls get trickier every tier. But its a necessary process. Try and get this process passive so you can fill out your factory with UV machines!
Take the Yttrium Barrium Cuprate and make wires.
Just gotta process the Liquid down into an ingot. But now that we are in the UV tier, we have the speed and power to do it quickly!
For all your UV tier processing needs!
Now we can upgrade our multiblocks to run at UV processing speeds! Lets go!
What, was UV Energy Hatches not enough?
Fine. Heres a 4A UV Energy Hatch! Now you can run your machines at UHV speeds! If UV was not enough, now you really got the power!
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ulvCircuit.1: This little guy will allow us to make the ULV circuit as cheap as possible
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ulvCircuit.2: That's right, there is a ULV circuit, the predecessor is the vacuum tube
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ulvCircuit.3: §eExtra info§r: SoC or System on Chip is basically a mini computer on a chip, it handles all the computing work
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ulvOnTheCheap.1: You may be wondering, why bother making an LV chip? Isn't this §6HV§r?
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ulvOnTheCheap.2: Well, yes, but what if you wanted a new LV machine? Wouldn't you rather get it for less resources than you were previously?
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ulvOnTheCheap.3: Operating 40 LV machines is 4 times more energy efficient than operating 10 HV machines, so long as the recipe runs at LV
i18n.quest.gregtech.desc.ulvOnTheCheap.4: The §bMV§r circuit, in its final form!
