There are several other tabs to check out, mostly for statistics on your network!
i18n.quest.power.desc.battery: §9IntegratedDynamics§r provides a simple power storage system. The batteries can even be combined in a crafting grid to increase the overall storage!
i18n.quest.power.desc.betterpipez:
To make your pipes extract more power, you'll want to make it an upgrade.

Once you've shift+right-clicked a pipe to set it to extract, you can insert a pipe upgrade into it by right-clicking the pipe with the upgrade. You can also right-click with an empty hand and add it using the GUI!

To be able to set filters, you'll need at least an §9Advanced Pipe Upgrade§r.
i18n.quest.power.desc.cables:
Mekanism offers a nice looking cable to transfer your power.

If the machine you are connecting to already pulls or pushes power, you will not need to configure the cable. Otherwise, you'll need a §9Configurator§r to configure the pipe. Shift+right-clicking will change the cable to pull or push mode.
i18n.quest.power.desc.cells:
RFToolsPower has §9Powercells§r to store power, which are multi-block storage units that can be customized and upgraded to store power.

You will need a wrench to determine inputs and outputs for power.
i18n.quest.power.desc.coal:
The RFTools Coal Generator is one of the easiest coal-burning generators to make.

It is very simple to use and creates a decent amount of power based on the combustible material you input. It automatically distributes power to adjacent blocks as well.
i18n.quest.power.desc.controller:
Flux Networks also provides a way to charge your items wirelessly, even across dimensions!

Once you have a Plug attached to your power system, you'll want to make the §9Flux Controller§r and place it down.

Right click to bring up the interface, and go to the 'Wireless Charging' tab. From here, you can select each section of your inventory you'd like to keep charged. To activate, make sure to hit the toggle at the bottom to Enable Wireless charging, then click apply!
i18n.quest.power.desc.core: In this mod, you'll need §aFlux Cores§r and §aFlux Blocks§r to craft the core parts of your network. Make a few of each!
i18n.quest.power.desc.cube:
Mekanism is one of the best mods for energy storage, especially in the early game.

The Basic Energy Cube is easy to configure, easy to craft, and stores a lot of power. It can also be upgraded, and can charge items inside of the interface!

To learn more about upgrading the Energy Cube as well as the mod, head over to the §aMekanism§r questline!
i18n.quest.power.desc.early:
Looking for early game power options? These are good ways to get you started with generating power.

These don't produce a ton of power, but they are typically easy or cheap to get in the early game!
i18n.quest.power.desc.end:
If you're looking to generate a ton of power, you can start by scaling up some of the options from the §9Mid Game Power§r section. Make your §eExtreme Reactors§r bigger. Upgrade your §9Thermo Gens§r to Nitro. Go wild.

§9Mekanism§r also has an end game power option that is tough to beat.

The §dFusion Reactor§r can produce up to 200MRF/t, and if you want to learn how to build it, make sure to check out the §aMekanism:§r §dAdvanced§r Chapter!
i18n.quest.power.desc.flux:
§9Flux Networks§r is a mod that aims to be the solution to all of your wireless power needs.

The mod itself does not have a way to generate power, but it can store and wirelessly transmit power, even across dimensions. It can even charge your items in your inventory.

You can even charge your jetpack while you are flying with this mod. HOW COOL IS THAT?

To get started with the mod, you'll need some Flux Dust. Head to bedrock level, then throw some redstone on top of a block of bedrock. Place a block of obsidian right above the floating redstone, then left click the obsidian.
i18n.quest.power.desc.flux_storage:
Flux Networks does provide a way to store the power you generate for your network!

These hold massive amounts of power overall, and can be upgraded to store even more!
i18n.quest.power.desc.gas:
If you've ever heard of someone talking about 'Melon Power', this is it. Mekanism's §9Gas-Burning Generator§r can produce a good amount power by pumping in §9Ethylene§r made from Melon Slices.

To produce §dEthylene§r, start by crushing organic materials in a §eCrusher§r to create §6Bio Fuel§r. Melon Slices are typically used for this! This is then pumped into a §dPressurized Reaction Chamber§r (PRC for short).

The PRC needs Water, Bio Fuel, and some Hydrogen to create Ethylene. You can get the Hydrogen from separating water in an §9Electrolytic Separator§r. 

Once you've started producing the Ethylene, pump it into the Gas-Burning Generator to start generating power!
i18n.quest.power.desc.heat:
§aMekanism's§r Heat Generator is a different take on basic power production. It has two modes of creating power:

§9Passive:§r Surrounding the generator with lava source or flowing blocks creates passive power over time through heat. Place one lava source block on top and let it flow over the sides. Make sure to have pipes connected for energy first!

§9Active:§r Placing combustible materials such as coal or wood into the generator will burn the fuel to create power. This is not very efficient.
i18n.quest.power.desc.meka:
Mekanism provides several ways to make power using renewable resources.

The §9Solar Generators§r harness the power of the sun to provide basic power needs. It does not work during the night, and must have access to the sky. Glass is okay.

The §9Wind Generator§r provides power via the wind. Unless you've figured out a way for your character to manually spin this, the speed it spins is based off of the Y lvl it is placed at. It also needs direct access to the sky without any blocks above it.
i18n.quest.power.desc.mid:
You can't power your base off of Coal forever! If you've got a decent amount of resources available, it's time to upgrade your power setup!

These options usually require a little setting up, but produce enough power to carry you far into your playthrough.
i18n.quest.power.desc.more:
§9Mekanism's§r §aInduction Matrix§r is the ultimate way to store your power.

If you're looking for the best power storage in the game, check out the §aMekanism:§r §dAdvanced§r Chapter.
i18n.quest.power.desc.moving:
If you're looking for different ways to get power out of your machines, this is where you can find it!

There are several options, both §awired§r and §9wireless§r, for transferring power.
i18n.quest.power.desc.network:
Right-click on your plug and you'll see the Flux Network UI. On the far top-right corner, click on the + button to create your first network. You'll need to set a password to create the network, but you can also set a color!

From here, you can go to the Network Selection tab to activate your network on the plug. If the plug is attached to a power source, you can now harness that power anywhere in your system using a Flux Point!

Pro Tip: You can create multiple networks if you want to have different power sources powering different parts of your systems!
i18n.quest.power.desc.pipez:
These are simple pipes that can be upgraded with Pipe Upgrades.

To 'extract' power from a block, place the pipe down next to the block, and on the side that is connected, shift+right-click with the pipe wrench to set the pipe to extract.

The §9Pipez§r mod also offers ways to transport items, gases, and liquids as well! Or you can make an All-In-One Pipe called the §aUniversal Pipe§r.
i18n.quest.power.desc.plug:
The first item you'll need to start your Flux Network is a §9Flux Plug§r.

The Plug is used to 'draw' power from the block it is attached to. Aside from a small buffer, the Plug does not store power itself, so don't worry about it zapping up all of your power.

It is suggested to place the Plug on a power storage block like an energy cube. It can connect to cables, pipes, or the output of any power producing machine.

To learn how to set up your first network, check the next quest!
i18n.quest.power.desc.point:
With our plug set up, we can now tap into the power from our network. The §9Flux Point§r does exactly that. It points the power from your network to whatever block it is attached to, including pipes or cables, or just directly on machines!

Once you've placed your point on the machine or block you want to power, right click on it and select your network in the Network Selection tab. Just like the plug, you can adjust how much power it pulls, priority level, etc.
i18n.quest.power.desc.powah:
Believe it or not, the §dPowah§r mod has some great options for getting... powah.

Make sure to check out the §cPowah§r Chapter to learn more!
i18n.quest.power.desc.reactors:
§9Extreme Reactors§r offers multi-block reactors that are completely customizable in size, efficiency, and more.

To learn more about getting started with Extreme Reactors, check out the questline for the mod!
i18n.quest.power.desc.storage: This section shows you different ways to store your power!
i18n.quest.power.subt.QE: Also works for items, gases, liquids, and heat.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.advancedB: With the vanilla Beehive, we'll use this to craft an §eAdvanced Beehive§r. It can be Oak or any kind of wood.
Bees will fly in and out of these, and drop off Honeycombs in the inventory. You can also insert glass bottles to get Honey Bottles.
We'll need plenty of Honeycombs for treats!
Place some empty §eAdvanced Beehives§r in an unlit area. The bees will move in over time.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.allthemod: To get the Allthemodium Bee, breed a Withered Bee with an Ancient Bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.ashyMinin: The Ashy Mining Bee is spawned from a Dirt, Gravel, or Sand Nest.
If you want one of these, you'll need an Ashy Mining Bee first.
Once the Ashy Mining Bee is cozy in its nest, there is a chance for a Nomad Bee to take it over.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.atmBees.1: If you want the ATM bees, it takes a lot of capturing and breeding and feeding.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.atmBees.2: The following part of the questline outlines which bees you'll need to move forward.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.atmBees.3: Make sure to check JEI and the §9Big Book of Bees§r for more info!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.beeCatche: Used to catch bees that are flying around it.
You can use a Filter Upgrade to filter out which bees you want to catch, as well as a BaBee Upgrade to only catch baby bees.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.beeCreati: Aside from luring bees in with nests, most bees require either §eBreeding§r or §9Conversion§r to bee created. (No, that isn't a typo.)
§eBee Breeding§r requires 2 bees and specific items fed to them to cause them to mate.
§9Bee Conversion§r requires you to feed a bee a specific item to convert it into a new bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.beeDaycar: This can be used to speed up the growth rate of baby bees, or to create new spawn eggs.
Place a caged baby bee with 20 Honey Treats to turn it into an adult.
To create spawn eggs, you'll need to combine the gene of the bee you want with a honey treat, then use that honey treat in this machine with an egg to create the new spawn egg.
Genes can be combined for a maximum of 100% purity, which will give you a 100% chance to convert an egg to a bee spawn egg.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.beeFarm.1: To get our own bee farm going, we'll have to find us some bees... and capture them.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.beeFarm.2: Right-clicking a bee with this will capture it!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.beeFarm.3: Adventuring can also net you some §6Sturdy Bee Cages§r, so keep an eye out!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.beeFarmFa: If you want to turn your Bee Farm into a factory for resources, you'll need to start by spawning in Bees with §6Nests§r.
The nests must be placed in specific biomes, which you can find in the JEI for it (look for the I icon at the top).
To lure in a bee to the nest, right click on it with a §9Honey Treat§r. Nests will not work without the treats!!
§9Important Note§r: Certain bees will only live in Nests and will not go into Advanced Hives. If they don't produce a honeycomb, they need to live in a nest instead.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.beehiveSe: Using the vanilla method, go ahead and make yourself a §9Beehive§r to have your own little setup!
These can hold 3 Bees each, but we won't be using it for long....

Bees will only create Honey and Honeycombs if they have the right flowers. Vanilla bees can use any flower, but most bees in the mod will require a specific block! Make sure to check JEI for more info.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.bottlerUs: The Bottler has two uses: Bottling honey and squshing bees for genes.
To get genes from bees, place a piston above the Bottler with a block of space between them.
Place the bee on top of the Bottler, and activate the piston to squish the bee into genes. The resulting squished bottle can be then placed in a Centrifuge.
Note: Make sure to have bottles in the Bottler.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.centrifug: The §9Centrifuge§r is used to process Combs from Bees into useful items and honey! While you can definitely just use a regular §9Centrifuge§r in the beginning, getting a §6Powered Centrifuge§r soon after is a must. This is a faster Centrifuge that runs off of power!
If you're looking for the best way to process your Combs, the §cHeated Centrifuge§r is even faster and can even process §aComb Blocks§r!
These can all be made faster by using Speed Upgrades.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.collectin: When collecting genes, you'll get a percentage of a trait. You can combine them in a crafting table to add them together, or place them in a Gene Indexer to auto-combine.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.crystalli: The Crystalline Bee is spawned from a Quartz Nest.
This bee is needed to make many of the other metal bees, like Iron and Copper.
This nest attracts §eCrystalline Bees§r. You'll need Nether Quartz instead of using Honey Treats to attract the Bee.
The easiest way to get a quartz block is by mining it with a Silk Touch pick.
Tip: Brass has the Silk Touch trait when making a Silent Gear tool.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.diamondBe: Breed the Ender Bee with a Lapis Bee to create a Diamond Bee!
The §eDirt Nest§r can be placed in any overworld biome to lure in bees.
It can lure the Ashy Mining Bee, Chocolate Mining Bee, and the Leafcutter Bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.eccentric: You can find this in the Eccentric Tome you start with, but if you somehow lost it, craft one!
This guidebook will help you learn everything about bees.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.emeraldBe: Once you have a Diamond Bee, breed it with the Slimy Bee to create an Emerald Bee!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.endStoneN: Create yourself an §5End Stone Nest§r and head to the End to capture one of these bees!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.enderBees: You'll need these for Ender Bees.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.enderNest: To attract Bees to this nest, you'll need Popped Chorus Fruit instead of Honey Treats.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.expansion: Expansion boxes are placed on top of your Advanced Beehives to increase the amount of bees that can be in the hive to a total of 5 slots.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.flyBee.1: Have you ever wanted to fly on a bee?
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.flyBee.2: Bumble Bees naturally spawn in the world, and they can be used as mounts!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.flyBee.3: Make yourself a §6Treat on a Stick§r, slap a saddle on a Bumble Bee, and take to the skies!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.glowstone: When placed in the Nether and given Glowstone, the Glowstone Nest will lure in a Glowing Bee.
You'll need to grab yourself a §6Glowstone Nest§r and head to the Nether to capture this bee!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.gravelNes: The Gravel Nest will lure bees in either a River biome or Beach biome.
It lures in the Ashy Mining Bee, Chocolate Mining Bee, and the Digger Bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.hiveCatch: When installed in a hive, it gives a 5% chance for a new baby bee to be spawned every time honey is delivered.
When placed in a Catcher, it only allows the catcher to catch baby bees.
You can stack these for a greater chance.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.hiveCentr: Can be placed in a hive or centrifuge.
When in a hive, it decreases the amount of time bees spend in the hive by 20%.
When placed in a Centrifuge, it increases the processing speed.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.itemColle: Collects items on the ground and brings it back to its nest.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.itemPicku: Will pick up items and bring them back to its hive.
Not as good as a Hoarder Bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.lapisBeeC: Breed a Redstone Bee with a Blue Banded Bee to get a Lapis Bee!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.luresGold: Instead of using Honey Treats, this hive requires Gold Ingots to attract Bees.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.nestDirec: Right-clicking on a Nest of the type you are looking for will point you in the direction of another!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.nests.1: Wood Nests are used to lure Carpenter Bees and the Blue Banded Bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.nests.2: Dark Oak Nests lures 3 different bees.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.nests.3: These can be placed in any Overworld Biome.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.netherBri: Placing the Nether Brick Nest in the Nether will lure in a Magmatic Bee when given Magma Cream.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.obsidianN: The Obsidian Nest will lure in Draconic Bees when placed in the End.
These do not accept Honey Treats, but instead use Dragon's Breath.
Place an Obsidian Nest in the End to lure this bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.productiv: In Productive Bees, you don't spend most of your time flying around trying to find certain bees.
Instead, you spawn them using Nests with §6Honey Treats§r.
With these, you'll create yourself some Nests and right click them with the treats to lure Bees in. Some Nests require special items instead of Honey Treats, so make sure to check JEI for more info!
Make sure to check out which biome you need to be in to lure in the right bees!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.redstoneB: With the Glowing Bee, breed it with the Chocolate Mining Bee to get a Redstone Bee!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.reedNest: A Reed Nest will work in any overworld biome, and will lure in a Mason Bee or a Reed Bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.sandNest: When placed in a Desert biome, the Sand Nest will attract either the Chocolate or Ashy Mining Bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.showingOf: Proud of the bees you have?
Wanna put them into a jar to show it off?
Place a Bee Jar down and use a pipe or hopper to insert the caged bee into the jar.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.slimyNest: When placed in a swamp biome, the Slimy Nest will lure in Slimy Bees.
You can lure these bees in using a Slimy Nest in a swamp biome.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.snowNest: Placing a Snow Nest in a snowy biome will lure in a Sweat Bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.stoneNest: The Stone Nest can be placed in any overworld biome to lure in a Mason Bee or Digger Bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.tinBees: Tin Bees are made by breeding a Crystalline Bee with an Ashy Mining Bee.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.unobtaini: Once you have the Allthemodium and Vibranium Bees, breed them together to get an Unobtainium Bee.
To breed: Feed the Allthemodium Bee 4 ingots of Vibranium, then feed the Vibranium Bee 4 ingots of Unobtainium.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.upgradeBa: The Upgrade Base is used to craft the various Upgrades in Productive Bees.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.vibranium: Breed a Draconic Bee with an Ancient Bee to get a Vibranium Bee!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.welcome.2: To get started with the mod, you'll first need to find some Honeycombs and Honey Bottles! Find yourself a Beehive, and let the bees do their work for a little. Shearing it when it is full will give you honeycombs, and glass bottles will give you Honey Bottles!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.desc.welcome.3: §9Important Note§r: With the bee quests requiring combs, the recipes will not be shown. Make sure to look them up in JEI if you need them!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.feedShroombeeB: Feed a Shroombee a Brown Mushroom!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.gravelStoneNes: Spawned using a Gravel or Stone Nest
i18n.quest.productiveBees.netherBrickNes: Spawned using a Nether Brick Nest in the Nether
i18n.quest.productiveBees.overworldBumbl: Spawns in the Overworld from Bumble Bee Nests
i18n.quest.productiveBees.soulSandNestNe: Spawned using a Soul Sand Nest in the Nether.
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.advancedB: Spawns in empty Advanced Beehives in a dark place
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.ashyMinin: Spawns in a nest that has an Ashy Mining Bee
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.beeFilter: Used to add Bees to a Filter
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.blueBande: Spawns in a nest that has a Blue Banded Bee
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.cocoaPods: Random Chance to Spawn when breaking Cocoa Pods in a Jungle
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.coldBiome: Lures the Sweat Bee in Cold Biomes
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.crystalli: Lures in Crystalline Bees in the Nether
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.draconicE: Lures a Draconic Bee in the End
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.enderEnd: Lures in Ender Bees when placed in the End
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedCrims: Feed a Shroombee a Crimson Fungus!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedDiamo: Feed Diamond Bee a Block of Netherite
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedFluix: Feed a Spatial Bee a Fluix Pearl!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedHoppe: Feed a Vanilla Bee a Hopper!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedProsp: Feed a Crystalline Bee a Prosperity Block!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedRedMu: Feed a Shroombee a Red Mushroom!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedRuby: Feed a Diamond Bee a Ruby!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedSapph: Feed a Diamond Bee a Sapphire!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedShulk: Feed a Collector Bee a Shulker Shell!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedSkele: Feed a Skeletal Bee a Withered Rose
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.feedSouli: Feed a Ghostly Bee a Soulium Dagger!
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.geneExtra: Extracts Genes from Bees in Hives
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.ghostlyBe: Lures in Ghostly Bees when placed in the Nether and given Ghast Tears
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.lumberQua: Lumber and Quarry Bees will give Blocks instead of Chips
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.luresGold: Lures a Gold Bee when placed in the Nether
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.machineRa: Increases the Range of a Machine
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.magmaticN: Lures in a Magmatic Bee when placed in the Nether
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.netherGlo: Lures a Glowing Bee in the Nether
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.overworld: Can be used in any Overworld biome
Lures Bees in any Overworld Biome
Lures bees in any Overworld Biome
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.preventTe: Prevents Bees from Teleporting in a Hive
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.quartzNes: Spawns from a Quartz Nest in the Nether
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.riverBeac: Lures in bees in River and Beach Biomes
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.spawnedEm: Spawned with empty Beehives in the Dark
i18n.quest.productiveBees.subt.swampBiom: Lures in a Slimy Bee in a Swamp Biome
i18n.quest.rs.desc.1024kfluid: The 1024k Fluid Storage Part is used to craft the 1024k Fluid Storage Disk.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.1024kstorage: The 1024k Storage Disk can store 1024000 items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.1048mfluid: The 1048m Fluid Storage Part is used to craft the 1048m Fluid Storage Disk.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.1048mstorage:
You won't believe this.

The 1048m Storage Disk can store 1048m items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.16384kfluid: The 16384k Fluid Storage Part is used to craft the 16384k Fluid Storage Disk.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.16384kstorage: The 16384k Storage Disk can store 16384000 items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.16kstorage: The 16k Storage Disk can store 16000 items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.1kstorage: The 1k Storage Disk can store 1000 items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.1kstorage_block:
Don't like storing things in drives?

You can create storage §9Blocks§r instead and just slap the block down somewhere in your system.

Whatever items end up in the block will be stored inside whenever you break it as well.

If you want to un-craft it, you can sneak right click while holding it.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.256kfluid: The 64k Fluid Storage Part is used to craft the 64k Fluid Storage Disk.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.256kstorage: The 256k Storage Disk can store 256000 items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.262mfluid: The 262m Fluid Storage Part is used to craft the 262m Fluid Storage Disk.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.262mstorage: The 262m Storage Disk can store.... well....  262m items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.4096kfluid: The 4096k Fluid Storage Part is used to craft the 4096k Fluid Storage Disk.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.4096kstorage: The 4096k Storage Disk can store 4096000 items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.4kstorage: The 4k Storage Disk can store 4000 items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.64kfluid: The 64k Fluid Storage Part is used to craft the 64k Fluid Storage Disk.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.64kstorage: The 64k Storage Disk can store 64000 items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.65536kfluid: The 65536k Fluid Storage Part is used to craft the 65536k Fluid Storage Disk.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.65536kstorage: The 65536k Storage Disk can store 65536000 items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.WCG: Allows you to access your grid wirelessly but with a crafting table built-in.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.WFG: Allows you to access your fluid grid wirelessly.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.WG: Allows you to access your storage wirelessly.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.advanced_housing:
It's like the regular one but ADVANCED.

These are used to house the larger Disk Drives.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.autocrafting: §9Patterns§r are the bread and butter of autocrafting. These store recipes to let your RS network know how to craft items.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.cables:
§9Cables§r are used to connect blocks and items to your system.

In the beginning, you can get by with placing blocks next to each other to connect them to your system, but Cables allow you to extend out! This is a staple for any Refined Storage Network.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.constructor:
This interface will place the designated block in the direction it is pointed.

You can designate the block within the GUI. This is useful for automation!
i18n.quest.rs.desc.crafter:
The §9Crafter§r is how we store patterns for our Network to know how to craft items. Once a recipe is placed into the crafter, you'll be able to 'Request' an item to be crafted from your Grid. You can do this by hitting CTRL+Shift when clicking on the item you have a recipe for to bring up the crafting GUI.

This block can also be placed facing a machine to use §6Processing Patterns§r. For example, if you point the Crafter at a Furnace, you can put a recipe inside for a recipe you need a furnace for, like smelting raw processors. As long as the crafter is attached to your system and the Furnace has an importer attached to it, the Crafter will allow you to request the smelted version of the Processor!
i18n.quest.rs.desc.crafting_grid:
This lets you access your storage, but with a crafting table!

Let's be honest, no one just uses regular Grids.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.crafting_monitor:
When attached to your system, the §9Crafting Monitor§r allows you to see what items are currently in your crafting queue.

You'll need one of these if you want to be able to cancel crafts that aren't working or are bugged.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.destructor:
This interface will automatically break the block it is attached to.

You can also set it to whitelist blocks, which is useful for automating certain processes, like making casings in Create.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.destructor_upgrade:
These upgrades add enchantments to your Destructor.

Wondering why you would use this? Imagine having a Builder or Quarry pump Silk-Touched Ores into your system. You can have a Constructor place these ores, then a Destructor with Fortune on it to break it for even more raw ores.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.diamond: An upgraded crafter that holds more patterns and has an increased crafting speed.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.dimension:
But this one does!

This allows your RS system to be accessed wirelessly from any dimension.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.disk_manipulator: Allows you to take items and fluids from one disk into another grid's disks.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.eliteD: Has 18 filter slots and works 2x faster.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.eliteE: Has 9 more filter slots and is 2x faster than the regular Exporter.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.exporter:
The §9Exporter§r is used to push items from your system into a block from your Network storage.

This can be used to fill Furnaces with ores or fuel, push materials into designated chests, etc.

You can also filter what items are pushed. Need more filter slots? Upgrade it!
i18n.quest.rs.desc.external:
This type of cable interface is probably the most important item one can make in their Refined Storage journey.

This type of cable interface connects an external storage to your Refined Storage Network. It basically lets RS look into the storage container to let you access it within your grid!

This works on many things, including but not limited to: Chests, Barrels, Drawers, Drawer Controllers, and more!

If you can't make drives and have a bunch of chests everywhere, this is your best bet in creating a storage Network!
i18n.quest.rs.desc.filter: The §9Filter§r is an item used in a Grid to specify which items or fluids can be visible.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.fluid_grid:
Plan on storing Liquids? You'll need a §9Fluid Grid§r to be able to see what fluids you have in your Fluid Disks. 

Pro Tip: If you want to store gases from Mekanism, see if you can turn it into a liquid first using a Rotary Condensentrator.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.gold: An upgraded crafter that holds more patterns and has an increased crafting speed.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.grid:
Because of the Controller limit, you'll probably end up wanting to connect different systems to your main hub without a billion cables connecting them.

This is done using §6Network Transmitters§r and §6Receivers§r.

§9Transmitters§r should be connected to your main system, wherever your Controller is.

The §9Receiver§r should go wherever you want your external network to be. For example, this can be a separate part of your base where you have Bees, a mob farm, etc.

To connect the Receiver to your main network, you'll need to use a §eNetwork Card§r. To bind the Network Card, right-click on the Network Receiver, and then place the Network Card into the Network Transmitter that is attached to your main system.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.housing:
It's time to create the 'Hard Drives' of Refined Storage. To do this, we'll need a §9Storage Housing§r that we'll combine with a §aStorage Part§r to create a §dStorage Disk§r. Just simply make the desired size of the part, then combine with the housing to create a disk.

The Storage Disk is used to store your items virtually once placed inside of the Disk Drive. It has to be put in a Disk Drive. The Storage Disk won’t despawn when dropped in the world.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.importer:
The §9Importer§r is used to pull items from a connected block.

For example, you can use these on Furnaces to pull the finished product out into your system.

Make sure to grab some §6Speed§r or §6Stack§r upgrades for them!

You can also filter what items are pulled. Need more filter slots? Upgrade it!
i18n.quest.rs.desc.infiniterange:
'I need more RANGE!!!'

Well, slap one of these bad boys in your Wireless Transmitter and you'll be able to access your network storage with infinite range.

This, however, does not extend to other dimensions.....
i18n.quest.rs.desc.iron: An upgraded crafter that holds more patterns and has an increased crafting speed.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.monitor: When connected to your system, this block will display the current number of an item within your network.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.netherite: An upgraded crafter that holds more patterns and has an increased crafting speed.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.network:
Great! We can store items virtually, but how do we see what is on the network?

To access the system, you'll need to create a §9Grid§r. The Grid is the most basic form of 'Display' for the items in your inventory.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.pattern_grid:
This grid allows you to imprint recipes onto patterns for your network.

The easiest way to create a recipe for a pattern is to look up the item in JEI, then click the '+' button in the bottom right of the recipe. This will then place the recipe into the grid.

On the right side, the top slot is used for storing blank Patterns. With a blank Pattern inside, you should be able to click the Arrow underneath to imprint the recipe onto the pattern.

You'll then want to put the Pattern into a crafter!
i18n.quest.rs.desc.portable_grid: The Portable Grid is a portable storage that isn’t connected to a network. It allows you to interact with a Storage Disk while not being connected to a network.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.range:
To increase the range of your wireless connection to your system, you'll need to craft §9Range Upgrades§r.

The Wireless Transmitter can only hold 4 total. Here's one on the house.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.refined:
§9Refined Storage§r is a mass storage mod that offers a network-based storage system.

To get started with the mod, you'll want to make the §6Controller§r.

The Controller is the 'Core' of your storage network. When provided with power, it gives life to all RS components connected. Each network can only have one Controller.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.security:
The §9Security Manager§r allows you to grant access and permissions to users within your network.

When placed in your system, you'll need to create a §9Security Card§r for each player you'd like to configure permissions for. When no cards are present, everyone has access to all permissions.

To restrict permissions and access to all unconfigured players, configure a card that isn't bound to a player and put it into the manager. The person who placed the Security Manager will always have access to it.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.speeding:
The §9Speed Upgrade§r does exactly what it says it does. It will increase the speed at which the interface/block works. Need an importer to pull faster? Want your crafters to work faster? This is the upgrade!

The §6Stack Upgrade§r increases the speed of transfer by a stack of items rather than just one. Combine with Speed Upgrades!
i18n.quest.rs.desc.transmitter: To connect the Receiver to your main network, you'll need to use a §eNetwork Card§r. To bind the Network Card, right-click on the Network Receiver, and then place the Network Card into the Network Transmitter that is attached to your main system.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.ultraD: Has 36 filter slots and works 6x faster.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.ultraE: Has 27 more filter slots and is 6x faster than the regular Exporter. Also has the Stack Upgrade integrated.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.upgrades:
The §9Regulator Upgrade§r allows you to maintain a certain amount of items within a block or machine. A great example of this is telling your network that you want to keep 64 Coal within a Furnace. You'd place the upgrade in the exporter attached to the furnace, and set it to 64. Your system will then try to keep the furnace full of fuel!

But what if you need an item that is crafted? The §9Crafting Upgrade§r does exactly this. If you have the recipe learned inside of a crafter, adding this upgrade to an interface will let it know to craft it if you run out.

Using our example from before, let's say we have a Mystical Ag farm going and have Coal Essence. We can then put the Coal recipe in a crafter connected to our system, then place this upgrade in the same exporter that is keeping the Furnace fueled. If you run out of Coal in your system, the crafting upgrade allows your system to craft some more!
i18n.quest.rs.desc.virtual_storage:
To store your items, you'll need to create disks that are stored in a §aDisk Drive§r. You can attach this to your network by placing it beside your Controller, or by using pipes.

These have 8 slots for Storage Drives.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.wireless:
If you want to access your Refined Storage network wirelessly, you'll need to start by creating a §9Wireless Transmitter§r.

You can attach this anywhere on your system. This is needed to use wireless grids.
i18n.quest.rs.desc.wrench:
The Wrench is a tool that can do two things: 
-> Rotate blocks 
-> Break Refined Storage covers.

Simply sneak and right click when using the Wrench.
i18n.quest.spawner.cactus: Tall Green Crops are now taller.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.anvil: Some of the items changed with Apotheosis is Enchantments for Anvils and Shears. Shears can now use the normal enchants but now including fortune and new enchants. Shears can get Growth Serum, Chromatic Aberation, and Workers Explotiation. You can discover what they do yourself. The Anvils can now be enchanted with Unbreaking and new enchants as well! Splitting and Obleritation. Both are used on the anvil then use the Enchanted Anvil to drop it on an Enchanted Book.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.apotheosis: Apotheosis is quite a big mod so I'm dividing it in 3 quests chapters. The Enchanting and Affixes will be separate. This one is for normal game changes.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.apple: By using a Golden Apple on a Spawner you suck the souls out the mobs that will be spawned, only leaving a hollow husk of what they used to be. The mobs will lose all AI so they will do basically what an armor stand does. They can't hit you, can't teleport, can't move on their own. They sit there ready to be killed, how exciting!
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.atm: To determine when the Spawner will spawn it picks a random number between maximum and minimum spawn delay. The Minimum can be as low as 100 to as high as 32,767. Each Ingot goes up or down by 10.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.cactus: You ever get bored of the 'normal' heights for cacti, bamboo, and sugarcane? You ever wish to see skyscrapers of Bamboo? Apotheosis can bring you your croppy Skyscrapers! Now height limits for Cacti, Bamboo, and Sugarcane have been increased! To how much? IDK, how tall is world height limit?
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.changes: Apotheosis adds some small changes to Minecraft, don't worry all are good and helpful!
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.conduit: The Conduit will do what the Prismarine Shards do but much better. Players no longer need to be near the spawner. As long as its chunk-loaded it will spawn.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.dragon: The must-need for all Spawners. When it says ignores all conditions, it means most. Ignores light levels, blocks needing for spawning, and biomes. Space conditions are still needed though, like slimes needing 3x3 area to spawn, and same goes with players needing to be nearby.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.egg: This one might be new to ones returning from earlier versions. By using a turtle egg on a spawner, it will only spawn in baby versions of the mobs in it. This only works with Vanilla baby versions of mobs, not modded.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.fletcher: The Fletching Table has been here since 1.14 and still is only used for a villager job! What about the players job?!?! Instead of making arrows with potion effects in a crafting table you can now use the Fletching Table. It's just cooler and more professional to use the designated table for it.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.ghast: Max entities is the amount of mobs that can be spawned by a spawner and kept. If it's only 6 max entities when 6 mobs are already spawned no more will spawned until they're dead or moved. Each Ghast Tear brings it up or down 2 Entities. Max of 16 Entities and Minimum of 1.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.lantern: Some mobs (mostly monsters) need certain Light Levels to spawn. Hostile ones needing lower levels and passive needing higher ones. Using a Soul Lantern makes it so you never have to worry about Light Levels as it ignores them! This does not ignore other requirements for spawning like livestock animals needing Grass. It's another one that gets ignored by Dragon Egg.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.piglich: The Piglich Heart is dropped by... well the Piglich. It can be used to increase the amount of mobs that CAN spawn from a spawner. The Mobs spawned is random with a Maximum amount determined by the Piglich Hearts. It goes up or down by 1 for each heart to a maximum of 8.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.prismarine: Activation Range is how close the Player (You) must be to the Spawner for it to work. The lowest it can be is 1 block away and the highest is 48 blocks away. They go in a circle around the spawner instead of direct blocks. The Condiut and Dragon Egg will ignore these.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.quartz: The Quartz makes whatever the other item does, it does the opposite for the Spawner. With Quartz in your offhand and the other Spawner Modification item in your main it will do the opposite of its role. With Quartz and Blaze Rods instead of increasing Spawn Range it will decrease it. With Quartz and Ghast Tears it'll decrease Max Entities.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.redstone: Redstone Activation gives your spawner an on/off switch. Without Redstone Power it will not spawn.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.rods: The Spawn Range is the area of where mobs can spawn. The bigger the area, the more room for them to spawn in. The smaller the area the cheaper the factory.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.spawner: Another game change Apotheosis brings is to Spawners. Remember being able to mine Spawners with Silk Touch? Well it's back thanks to Apotheosis! There's also many new Modifications you can add to Spawners by right clicking any of these items.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.unob: The Maximum Spawn Delay is how long it could take to spawn mobs. Just like the Minimum it can be as low as 100 to as high as 32,767. Each Ingot gives 10. The numbers are Minecraft ticks, 20 ticks equals 1 second. So quickest spawn delay would be 5 seconds between each.
i18n.quest.spawner.desc.wool: Wool only does one thing to the spawner and that's to shut it up. Don't like hearing the stupid Spawner noises? Then use Wool! Any color, thread count, or design!
i18n.quest.spawner.wool: Quiet down you'll wake up the mobs!
i18n.quest.storage.desc.NBT:
Looking to create virtual storage using §9Refined Storage§r or §9Applied Energistics 2§r?

These are both great ways to upgrade your storage, but it is important to talk about §eNBT Items§r and the best way to store them.

NBT items are items with extra tags attached to them. Enchanted items, items with durability, Apotheosis gems... these are all items with NBT tags attached to them. Because of this, they don't usually stack.

When you store a lot of these into a storage system like RS or AE2, you run the chance of creating issues for your save or server.

Because of this, it is best to store them in chests or bags!
i18n.quest.storage.desc.backpack: Sophisticated Backpacks offer upgradable backpacks that can also use filters to add nifty features!
i18n.quest.storage.desc.basic:
Welcome to the Basic Storage Chapter!

You'll find all of the basic ways to store items without power, as well as useful items for your storage needs!
i18n.quest.storage.desc.chest: Just like a vanilla chest, but has a slot for a Storage Upgrade!
i18n.quest.storage.desc.compacting:
This item can convert items placed inside to their nugget or block forms.

For example: An Iron Ingot placed in this will allow you to pull out 9 nuggets, or if more iron is placed in, will covert it to Iron Blocks.
i18n.quest.storage.desc.configurator:
The Configuration Tool is used to lock drawers for them to remember the item it has inside.

This is useful whenever you set up a system to pull and push from drawers. The locked drawer will not replace the item that was locked on it!
i18n.quest.storage.desc.controller:
When placed and connected with the §aLinking Tool§r to other drawers, this block acts as a 'Hub.'

If you double right-click this, all items within the Storage Drawers 'Network' will be pulled from your inventory.
i18n.quest.storage.desc.drawer: Craft yourself a 1x1 drawer. This item holds a ton of stacks of 1 item.
i18n.quest.storage.desc.ender:
Chests that work across dimensions.

Can be color coded for security! (Right click on the block with the desired dye).

*Note: If someone else uses your color combination, they can get the contents!
i18n.quest.storage.desc.enderdrawer:
Using a §aLinking Tool§r, you can link 2 Ender Drawers to sync up the contents.

This works just like an Ender Chest, but for Drawers.

To link, Right click the first Ender Drawer with the §aLinking Tool§r, then left click the second Ender Drawer to sync.
i18n.quest.storage.desc.functional:
Functional Storage is a mod for storing stacks of the same items.

This is useful for items like Cobblestone, Dirt, etc.
i18n.quest.storage.desc.iron: *Note: To upgrade an already placed vanilla chest to an Iron Sophisticated Chest, you will first need to convert the chest with a 'Basic Tier Upgrade.'
i18n.quest.storage.desc.link:
Used to link Drawers to a controller and to link up Ender Drawers.

To link Drawers to the Controller, right click the Controller block to start configuration. Right clicking Drawers will add them to the network.

Holding the tool will show you what Drawers are connected to the Controller.
i18n.quest.storage.desc.netherite: Even MORE slots for storage and upgrades.
i18n.quest.storage.desc.sophisticated:
Sophisticated Chests allows you to upgrade your chests with metals to increase storage! You can also add upgrade filters to increase the functionality of the chest.

No more vanilla double-chest rooms!
i18n.quest.storage.desc.trash: A way to destroy unwanted items, liquid, and power.
i18n.quest.storage.desc.upgrade:
To save you from having this §oentire quest section§r covered with filter upgrades, take a look at the Sophisticated Backpack upgrades.

You'll need to make the Sophisticated Storage equivalent, but they function about the same.
i18n.quest.storage.desc.upgrade_base: You will need these to make backpack filter upgrades.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.Acompacting: Compacts items in the backpack to their 3x3 recipe.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.PU: Adds the ability to pump liquids from the tank upgrade.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.battery: Adds a battery to the backpack.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.blasting: Adds a blasting GUI to the backpack.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.bpcompacting: Compacts items in the backpack to their 2x2 recipe.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.crafting: Adds a Crafting Table GUI to the backpack.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.deposit: Allows the backpack to be emptied.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.feeding: Auto-feed with food in the backpack.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.filter: Adds a filter for items being pumped in or out of the backpack.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.gold: A lot more room for activities.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.inception: I heard you like backpacks in your backpacks.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.iron: A single chest the size of 2.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.pickup: Allows the backpack to pick up items.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.refill: Keeps the player's inventory stacked up from items in the backpack.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.smelting: Adds a Smelting Tab to Backpack
i18n.quest.storage.subt.smoking: Adds a smoker GUI to the backpack.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.stack1: Increases stack size in the backpack.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.stonecutting: Adds a Stonecutting GUI to the backpack.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.tank: Adds a tank to the backpack.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.tool: Auto-Swap to the tool that is most effective for the block you are looking at.
i18n.quest.storage.subt.void: Adds a filter for items you want to auto-delete in the backpack.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.baseUpg: This is a base upgrade for all machines and items.
Note: While you can put several base upgrades into a machine, only the highest tier takes effect.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.chargeI: Can be used to charge items, augment machines, or fill up items with liquid.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.convert: Can convert certain blocks into liquids.
This is useful for generating lava from Cobblestone, Netherrack, etc.
Converts items from a liquid to a solid, some requiring casts.
There is also a bee spawn egg recipe it can create.
Can convert liquids into items or other useful liquids.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.createL: Can Create "Liquid" Potions that can be bottled into Potions.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.earlyGa: It's more like a pickaxe that uses RF/FE.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.enchant: Pro Tip: You can enchant these with §9Capacity§r to increase the storage!
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.extract: This machine is mostly for extracting dyes from flowers, or ore blends back into their components.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.inducti: The Induction Furnace combines materials into new alloys.
This is also useful when smelting Ancient Debris into Netherite Scraps.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.infinit: Creates an infinite water source when placed between two water source blocks.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.itemCha: This machine charges the items placed inside.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.liquidF: Note: This accepts Tree Oil, Creosote Oil, and Refined Fuel.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.machine: The Machine Frame is needed to craft various machines in Thermal Series.
This machine works like a Botany Pot, Garden Cloche, etc.
When given water and a seed, it will grow the seed inside of the machine and auto-output the products into the machine.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.modIntr: Thermal Series is a modular series of mods that adds a content-rich blend of magic and technology to your Minecraft experience!
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.pulveri: The Pulverizer breaks raw ores into dusts, and also has a 25% chance to create an extra dust.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.redston: The Redstone Furnace uses RF/FE instead of Coal to smelt items.
Like all machines in the Thermal Series, this machine can be upgraded with augments to increase the speed of each process.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.spreadE: Spreads Potion Effects to an area.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.stonePr: This machine can produce several types of stone.
Place 1 lava source block on one side, and 1 water source block on the other, and it will generate cobblestone. Check the recipes to see the other kinds of stone you can create!
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.tier2Up: This is a tier 2 upgrade for Thermal Series items and machines.
Note: While you can put several base upgrades into a machine, only the highest tier takes effect.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.tier3Up: Note: While you can put several base upgrades into a machine, only the highest tier takes effect.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.desc.workLik: Works like a Coke Oven, but simplified.
Insert "fuel" like Coal and it'll produce Coal Coke and a by-product.
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.subt.increas: Increases Efficiency at the cost of Speed
Increases Generation Rate at the Cost of Efficiency
Increases RF Capacity and Transfer Rate
Increases RF Capacity, and slightly increases the RF Transfer
Increases RF Transfer, and slightly increases the Capacity
Increases Processing Speed, but Reduces Efficiency
i18n.quest.thermalExpansion.subt.separat: Separates Items into their Crafting Components
i18n.quest.tips.desc.belt:
A quick way to switch between tools.

Upgrade with belt pouches in an anvil to increase capacity.
i18n.quest.tips.desc.compass:
Gives you a list of biomes you can search for.

Select a biome, then hit 'Search.' You'll see some info in the top left, and the compass will point in the direction of the biome.
i18n.quest.tips.desc.exp:
The §9Experience Crystal§r allows you to store experience, either by giving it your levels, or pumping in experience from a tank.

You can also transfer the experience stored to level yourself up with just a click of a button!
i18n.quest.tips.desc.magnet:
This is a simple magnet!

Pro tip: You can set a keybind to toggle this on and off!
i18n.quest.tips.desc.mahou: §4Increasing Innate Cap requires throwing Ender Upgrade Orbs (26 max) in Mahou lake along with Caliburn§r \n §5Converting Caliburn to Morgan requires killing Warden with Caliburn§r
i18n.quest.tips.desc.mobs:
When placed, the §9Mega Torch§r prevents all hostile mobs from naturally spawning in a 64 block radius.

Great for stopping hostile spawns in dark parts of your base
i18n.quest.tips.desc.powah:
Power Generation has had quite a bit of balancing!

Melon power is probably not the droid you were looking for!

Gas Burning Generators are only about 11% as strong as normal.

To compensate, starting Powah generators have been buffed.  Extreme Reactors have been buffed.  The Mekanism Bio Generator has been buffed. Generators Galore has stronger starting generators too!

§8Just between you and me,  a Powah nitro thermo gen with soul lava next to it makes 31.5k rf/t and only consumes water, but you didn't hear it from me. §r
i18n.quest.tips.desc.shrink: Use this item to shrink. Helpful for working on automation and also just overall fun.
i18n.quest.tips.desc.sink: Easy item to automate infinite water. Need more water? Make another!
i18n.quest.tips.desc.sleep:
The sleeping bag lets you sleep during the night.

The hammock lets you sleep during the day.

Neither will reset your spawn-point.
i18n.quest.tips.desc.spawner:
§6Remove AI: §r§m§4Chorus Fruit§r§r Golden Apple 
 §6Ignore Players: §r§m§4Nether Star§r§r Conduit 
 §6Increase Entities: §rGhast Tears | Max §m§432§r§r 16 
 §6Decrease Minimum Spawn Delay:§r §m§4Sugar§r§r AllTheModium Ingot | Min §m§420§r§r 100 
 §6Decrease Maximum Spawn Delay:§r §m§4Clock§r§r Unobtainium Ingot | Min §m§420§r§r 100
i18n.quest.tips.desc.stick:
Need a portable crafting table? How about a portable smithing table?

§9Crafting On A Stick§r adds portable versions of some of your favorite crafting tables! This is a must have in the early game.
i18n.quest.tips.desc.tricks: On this page, you'll find some useful items and info to help you on your journey!
i18n.quest.tips.desc.wand:
The mod §9Construction Wand§r adds helpful wands that are used when building.

When right-clicking a face of a block with the wand, it will extend that face out as long as you have the blocks in your inventory.
i18n.quest.tips.subt.sink: Can be used as Reactor Coolant
i18n.quest.tools.3pick2: Blue Skies and Aether Iron Pickaxes
i18n.quest.tools.6pick4: Mystical and Blue Skies Max Picks
i18n.quest.tools.6sword2: Botania and Blue Skies Iron Swords
i18n.quest.tools.desc.tier1: §9Tier 1§r Harvest Level is the lowest pickaxe level, needing a pickaxe. Any pickaxe can mine these. Items that are Tier 1 would be like Stone, Furnace, and Coal Ore.
i18n.quest.tools.desc.tier2: §fTier 2§r is the stone pickaxe level. It's almost only for mining Iron items.
i18n.quest.tools.desc.tier3: §bTier 3§r is Iron Pickaxe level, it mines most ores like Diamond, Emerald, and Gold.
i18n.quest.tools.desc.tier4: §5Tier 4§r is Diamond tool level, used to get Obsidian and Netherite. Also some modded ores like Uranium and Platinum.
i18n.quest.tools.desc.tier5: §eTier 5§r is basically just for AllTheModium Ore, not much else.
i18n.quest.tools.desc.tier6: §dTier 6§r is the highest tier, anything that is breakable can be mined with it, including Vibranium and Unobtainium.
i18n.quest.tools.desc.tool:
Welcome to Basic Tools!

Ever get a tool you've never seen or heard of and wanted to know where it lies among other tools? Then this quest is perfect for you!

(The swords are sorted by base damage, swords that can be upgraded or used to get more damage are not included)

(Please do not use this as a bucket list, finding all the tools and weapons will 99%% make you insane.)
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.claims1: To claim chunks, open up your map using §6M§r, then click the §aClaim Map§r icon in the top left.
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.claims2: To claim a chunk, left click and drag to claim.
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.claims3: To force load a chunk, shift-left click the chunk. If done properly, you'll see lines across the chunk.
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.commands:
There are plenty of helpful commands within ATM. Here are a few:

§e/sethome§r (name of home) | Let's you set a home that you can teleport back to using /home (name). Example: /sethome farm - then teleport with /home farm

§e/spawn§r | This will teleport you to the spawn of your overworld.

§e/rtp§r | 'Random Teleport' will teleport you to a random location in the world.

Note: These commands have cooldowns and limits. If you'd like to change them, you can edit the config file which can be found here:

- For Singleplayer | §osaves/(name of save)/serverconfig/ftbessentials.snbt§r

- For Servers | §oworld/serverconfig/ftbessentials.snbt§r
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.quests1: In this modpack, Quests are optional. Mods are not gated behind completing any quests!
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.quests2: The individual questlines outside of the Main questline are meant to serve as mod guides. If you want to follow the progression, make sure to check out the Main Questline!
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.quests3: Most of the quests in the pack are also made by §2AlfredGG§r. Quests are hard work, so if you'd like to support him, you can click on his player image below!
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.team: If you want to create a team for you and your friends, use the command §a/guild create (name of guild)§r to create the team!
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.welcome1: ATM9 is a kitchensink pack that allows you to explore the world of modded Minecraft in your own way!
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.welcome2: §lATM9 is currently in the beta stages of modpack development§r. Mods will be added or removed as they get updated.
i18n.quest.welcome.desc.welcome3: If you have any questions or issues, feel free to join the ATM discord!
item.kubejs.micro_universe_catalyst.tool: Forged in the fire of a thousand suns.
kubejs.apiary_ii.tooltip.bee_requirement: Requires Very High, Any, Metaturnal bees to run
